title: Women‚Äôs Fleece Lined Sweatpants Baggy Wide Straight Leg Pants
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars soft and warm but small in hips', 'author': 'Cam', 'rating': 5, 'content': "super comfortable fabric and very warm, great value for the price, can run a bit small in the hips(which I don't really notice until I sit or squat down) but other than that great sweatpants", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 15, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Exactly as pictured', 'author': 'James D.', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'These sweats are nice and warm, good quality. They are a little too short (I\'m 5\'6"), and the waistband is very tight. Other than that, they fit well. I wouldn\'t buy them again, simply because I have to alter the waist, but they will be perfectly fine once they fit better. If your waist is very small and your legs on the shorter side, go for it.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 19, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars SO comfy!!', 'author': 'Kacy Hobart', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'These sweats are so stinkin cute!! I love the bright pink color and they have kept up well!! Only problem is they shrunk in length when I dried them, but that‚Äôs probably user error ü•≤. Now they are a little high water on me, but I pair them with chunky shoes and they don‚Äôt look as short! They are so so soft and comfy though.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 19, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Nice thick open leg sweats.', 'author': 'Linda in NJ', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Perfect for lounging around the house. our older farmhouse is not exactly well insulated and these keep me warm. They do run quite baggy but I like them that way, so for me they are fine. I am 5‚Äô4 and 135lbs very athletic build. I could have bought a small if I wanted a better fit, but like I said I like them baggy. I fold over the waist. Love the pockets too. So far they wash well. I bought a few pair to teplace some older ones that have been worn out. I don‚Äôt wear these to exercise cuz they are too warm and Being thick cotton they hold onto water/sweat. But awesome for lounging which was what I got them for.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 3, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars Soft, but way too small', 'author': 'Mica Glass', 'rating': 3, 'content': 'I ordered a size large. I am 5\'-7" tall, 165 lbs, 45" hips because of a large butt, and 35" waist. When I opened the package, I was super excited to try them on because they were extremely well made and super soft on the inside. As soon as I pulled them over my hips, I was disappointed to find that they were extremely too small on me. The back end fit was too tight, and the front end had a ton of extra fabric, which I thought was strange. I ended up giving them to my son who is my height, but thinner than me. His pants size is a 32Wx31L, and they fit him perfectly.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 28, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '2.0 out of 5 stars Size up', 'author': 'D. Settle', 'rating': 2, 'content': 'I normally wear medium pants but these were way too small and no room for booty. I recommend sizing up one or two sizes if you have any kind of butt. The material is nice and the length was good but it does not stretch at all. I‚Äôll be returning. Might try a different brand.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 4, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars OBSESSED', 'author': 'Gabi', 'rating': 5, 'content': '5 stars love these, so cozy and comfy and flattering', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 29, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '1.0 out of 5 stars SIZE CHART IS VERY WRONG', 'author': 'REKS', 'rating': 1, 'content': 'I have been ordering sweat pants for winter and returning almost everything. The size charts are just so wrong. These AUTOMET Women‚Äôs Fleece Lined Sweatpants Baggy Wide Straight Leg Pants are another example.The fabric of these sweats are a little thinner than most, but sill soft and cozy. The pockets are decent. The length is great, too long, so if washed and dried you could hope the shrinkage would keep the length from going "high water" at the ankles. Unfortunately the width is just wrong. The stated hip width in the size chart is not your hip size. Instead it is the actual fabric measurement of 48". The pants fit snugly on a 45" hip. If you wash them and they shrink, they will be uncomfortably tight. Not baggy, tight. If you sew, you know that this fabric, if is not preshrunk prior to sewing it will shrink the first time you wash them. Knowing that the preferred ease on a 45" hip is a minimum of 3" these pants are guaranteed not to fit comfortably after washing. These are sweats, and dry cleaning makes no sense for everyday house pants.AMAZON, you need to check on these size charts that are provided. If it\'s providing the fabric size and not the actual hip size, it should state that fact. This is another case of the manufacturer skimping on the fabric length necessary to make pants for wider hips. 1"-2" of width at the hip, in a pair of pants, makes a huge difference to fit but will probably add 1/4-1/2 yards to the fabric needed to make them as the front and back have to be offset on the fabric, instead of being laid straight across on one width.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 14, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Runs small, size up for baggy fit', 'author': 'Amazon Customer', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'These sweats are super soft & can probably be so comfortable, when sized right. I usually wear a size medium in pants, but these are a little snug on my thighs/booty. I‚Äôd recommend going up a size or two.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 7, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Great quality, just not white', 'author': 'Hailey Rivard', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'These sweatpants are great quality! The only issue I had with them is that the white is not white. I bought these to go with a white sweatshirt and zip up of mine but the pants are more of a cream and look yellow compared to a true white.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 27, 2024', 'is_verified': True}]

title: Sport Xtemp Workout Pockets, Men's Training Pants
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great value!!!', 'author': 'Gerald Baker', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Just ordered these after an expensive pair of sport pants wore out. These are exactly what I was looking for...at a fraction of the price. These pants are lightweight, comfortable, and loose fitting. These are great lounge pants as well as suitable for wearing to run errands. Yes, these are nice.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 2, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Comfortable and Lightweight', 'author': 'ShopperOfThings', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I love these pants! I‚Äôm always hot and these are nice and lightweight so I‚Äôm not overheating. They do run slightly long though.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 10, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars The Good The Bad The Ugly', 'author': 'Greg', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'I have bought several of these over the past few years and as with anything there is the good, the bad and the ugly. The Good - These are probably the most comfortable pants you will ever wear. The material is light and soft. They look very good as well I wear with Polo shirts and T shirts. THE BAD - While I love draw stings I don\'t love these drawstrings. What they do is take a length of string and bring the ends together in the back of the pants and "sew the ends down". The problem is sometimes they don\'t get them sewed down very good at all. Some will come loose in the back and when it does it is almost impossible to get the string threaded back through the waist band. THE UGLY - While these are the most comfortable pants you will ever wear they are not durable. Granted the will NOT ball up but if you have to do anything where you are actually working they will wear, snag easily. These pants are very delicate and as long as you are doing no work they will be fine as long as the drawstrings stay sewed.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 18, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Workout Pants', 'author': 'Jim Murphy', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Good fit, good value', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 3, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars Incredibly long', 'author': 'Tyler', 'rating': 3, 'content': "These pants are very light and comfortable, however they're crazy long on the inseam. I'm 6' tall and the xl was a solid 6+ inches too long of an inseam for me. title: Women's Cinch Bottom Sweatpants Pockets High Waist Sporty Gym Athletic Fit Jogger Pants Lounge Trousers
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Very confartable', 'author': "Jack's dad", 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Bought these for the wife. The fit beautifully and she loves the way they feel..', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 3, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Nice pants', 'author': 'Amazon Customer', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Great for the price.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 9, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Comfortable, but not necessarily flattering', 'author': 'Madison', 'rating': 4, 'content': "I LOVE these pants. At this point, I own about 8 pairs. They are my go-to 'sitting around at home' pant and I wear them almost every day. They're thin enough to wear in hot weather, but aren't sheer, and the waistband is great (where it cinches in pretty far but can stretch a ton, in the XL it's 15 inches across the waistband un-stretched, and 30 inches when stretched all the way out).There are a few things that I would make a note of, though. Firstly, the different colors have different qualities. The grey is my favorite, it's the stretchiest and softest. The black is stiffer and thicker (but still a go-to for me), and the green is sheerer and more like an upscale legging or almost similar to a thin dress pant (and is my least favorite).These pants can also be quite unflattering. This is because the fit is a little weird (which is sort of expected with 'parachute' pants) but isn't my favorite. I am a little over 200lbs with a mildly athletic build (like, 'athlete who's let themselves go for a few years'), and primarily have these in size XL. The inseam is one of the main issues for me. I have normal length of leg, if not slightly short, where the inside of my leg is about 31 inches long. The inseam for these pants is 24.5 inches long, and there is about 15 inches between the end of the inseam and the top of the waistband. In order to get rid of that extra room, I roll the waistband 1-2x over, so that they generally look and fit like normal pants and so my legs to stick together when I walk. this makes the pants hit me in a weird place, though, like lower calf. The pants also tend to be thin enough to show, if you are not very thin/toned, an unfortunate texture on the thighs. Between these factors, the pants are so ugly even my friends and family have commented that these pants need to stay as house pants and never be worn in public.The only other issue with these is that they do stretch out when you wear them, so they'll be pretty tight for 2-3 wears, then get really loose, then go back to being tight after you wash them. They also wear in certain places and eventually get holes, but it takes a while to get to that point.In general, I find the grey and black versions of this to be amazing for working at home, doing chores, or laying around (or even sleeping), but are not great for going out. They're super comfortable and work in most types of mild weather, and because of that, I plan to continue buying more of these in the future.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States July 9, 2022', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '1.0 out of 5 stars Cheap', 'author': 'Regina B', 'rating': 1, 'content': 'For the price of the product you would expect higher quality. This sweat pants have the feel of Five and Below or Dollar Genera. This is over priced. The pants is a thin material and after further investigation the stitching is not the best. I have seen better quality sweatpants at lower prices.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 15, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars Not too thin, not too thick, super soft!', 'author': 'Brianna', 'rating': 3, 'content': 'I love that these are light weight, soft and will still keep me warm.. the color seems a bit lighter but I don‚Äôt mind, the waist was a bit higher than anticipated and I was hoping for a baggier look which it‚Äôs great on the legs just not butt, so I should have orders a few sizes up.Also I‚Äôm currently 33 weeks pregnant and had hoped these would roll down nicely but they don‚Äôt. Saving for after the baby üò¨', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States September 26, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Super comfy', 'author': 'Alexis', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'They‚Äôre lovely. I have 3 pairs. I am a dancer and I live somewhere where it‚Äôs hot year-round. These pants are SUPER COMFORTABLE!! They‚Äôre on the thinner side and don‚Äôt have the usual fuzzy inside that is associated with a lot of sweatpants, so it‚Äôs not really good if you‚Äôre looking for warmth. But for someone who is going for the look of sweats but without so much heat, it‚Äôs perfect!!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States September 12, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Quality', 'author': 'Edna Crosby', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Love them! Highly recommend this product and will,buy again.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 29, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '2.0 out of 5 stars Not great- thin, stiff, awkward', 'author': 'missburke', 'rating': 2, 'content': 'Most of the reviews were good so I was surprised at the low quality of these, especially for the price. The material is thin and stiff, almost "crunchy" even. I ordered the XL and they are very narrow in the waist and hip area. I don\'t think XXL would fit much better as they just did not have the normal "sweatpants" shape. I like that they cinch at the bottom but otherwise they are a pass for me. I can get name brand real comfy cinch bottom sweats for about the same price (and that is now my plan). I am expecting a baby soon and wanted nice black comfy sweatpants to come home from the hospital in. These will NOT suffice.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States August 25, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Not much cotton', 'author': 'N', 'rating': 4, 'content': "No way these are 95% cotton. They are more like rayon, polyester, spandex, and cotton. Cool to the touch and some kind of oily-feeling coating to them even after washing. I really can't tell what the material is, but I know what cotton feels and stretches like, and this is not that.However. They fit well, having enough room at the crotch and are high waisted. They don't shrink much, if at all. Fit true to size.So everything is good, except there's no way they're truthful about the material.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 23, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars Mixed Fit; Skip Ceylon', 'author': 'Brooke', 'rating': 3, 'content': 'I‚Äôve owned the black pair for almost a year now and I love them! The fabric isn‚Äôt sweatshirt, but it‚Äôs still decently warm (I‚Äôve been able to wear it year-round). Good for working out indoors or lounging. I have no reason to believe it‚Äôs not 100% cotton and I‚Äôm a sewist. Im 5‚Äô5‚Äù, 29‚Äù waist and the medium hits at my ankle and feel comfortable (not tight or loose) around my waist.I think the problem with these is the don‚Äôt look anything like what‚Äôs pictured. They aren‚Äôt overly baggy in pant leg width or length, nor are they fluffy.Now, I did have a big problem with the Ceylon color one. In the picture, it looks like a grey-green, but it‚Äôs actually a light, bright sea green in-person. Terrible color on me. I would have overlooked it if they hadn‚Äôt also been 3‚Äù too short! Disappointing since I have to drive 30 minutes to make returns. Skip this color unless you‚Äôre VERY petite!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 13, 2023', 'is_verified': True}]

Men's Cargo Pants with Pockets Cotton Hiking Sweatpants Casual Athletic Jogger Sports Outdoor Trousers Relaxed Fit
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars The material of the pants are worth it!', 'author': 'George L', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I love these pants. The material is durable cotton and soft with a little spandex to give that stretch of you need it. The fit true to size but I'm between xxl and 3x so the XXL fits me fine because that stretch. The length feels 32in to me which is good. I purchased the black and they are a very rich dark back color. High quality pants in my opinion. The back pockets and cargo pockets make it even better. The waist has a stretch so that gives you extra room which is a plus for me. Overall I'm very pleased with my purchase and will be buying other colors.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 31, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars I own 3 pairs', 'author': 'Johnny Gardner', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I buy alot of stuff on Amazon that is "off brand" some work out, some dont. These pants are GREAT ! Got a the light gray ones not expecting much, like it so much I now have black and Navy blue. Cool for casual wear with a hoodie or tshirt and some nice kicks. Material is a 7/10 and is decent but really comfortable. Waist is stretchy but not annoyingly fat person pants or bunch up. I am 6\'2 245lbs and get 3xl. Lil baggy but not overly and lenth gives 1 bend above lowtop nikes. Idk about shrinking yet.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 9, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Actual fit vs. size chart', 'author': 'Brett D Cohen', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'I hate buying clothing on-line. Why? Because you can\'t try it on before you buy it, and that can be a real hassle, right? But I took a gamble (again) due to the fact that it seems all my pants have shrunk over the last few months (wink) and I discovered other than sweats, I had no pants to wear. So, I purchased 3 pairs of these cargo-pants. Ok, now I\'m going to embarrass myself, but I\'m doing this to try and help you guys out, so cut me some slack. I\'m 5\' 10", 260 lbs. with a 53" waist and my leg length from belly button to floor is 42". Yes, I\'m a cow, so let\'s just get that out of the way. (oh, I don\'t really believe I\'m a cow, I just know I look like one) Ok, so, I ordered 3x size pants and the chart says they fit 35"-49" waist and are 44.5" in length.They arrived today and I tried one pair on. Much to my surprise, they fit great with even a couple of inches of room to spare around the waist. Remember, I have a 53" waist measured across the greatest girth (belly button level) and the size chart says 3x fits up to 49". So, the chart isn\'t exactly on target, and I might even fit into the 2x, but I\'m not going to get a pair of those just to see if I could. Now about the length. The length seems to be accurate with the chart, 44.5". I have some room to play with at the bottom and I\'m curious to see where they end up after washing. Other reviews claim some serious shrinking in length, by as much as 1.5"s after wash. If that is the case, then the bottoms should end up right on top of my shoes, and that\'s fine, though I would prefer just a little longer.The colors (I bought Black, Coffee, Brown) are very nice, especially the Coffee, really nice dark color. As for the material, lightweight, but not too light, feels durable but not stiff at all, very comfortable and easy to move, bend, squat in.Concerns: Not sure how durable the button closure is going to be, feels a bit flimsy, but buttons can always be replaced (right, honey?). The other concern is, again, shrinking after washing. I\'ve read some other reviews and this issue seems to be a common thread in them. However, I do have about 2" of play at the bottom, so I\'d imagine that even with some shrinking, I should end up ok. There is about 1" of hemmed up material that could be unstitched if it shrinks more than acceptable.I would certainly recommend these at this point. Probably would even if they shrunk an inch or so. Overall, they seem like a fine pair of pants, worth the price. Hope this helps.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 29, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great buy.', 'author': 'Nicolle Cartas', 'rating': 5, 'content': "Not sure why other people didn't give these pants 5 stars.They do slightly shrink after wash. I order a size up as I was expecting this. As long as you order up a size the will fit perfect. They are made of great material and are stiff like jeans but soft at the same time. My husband loves them. He wears them for work. We just ordered our 5th pair!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States August 29, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars Shrinks', 'author': 'jon', 'rating': 3, 'content': 'Like a lot of others these pants do shrink after a couple of washings. Since there were no reviews on shrinking length and the XXL length fits just below his ankle, I am ordering a couple more in different colors for summer pants.The ones I received, are well made and decent quality for the price.Should the other colors fit him the same, yea, then I\'m going to get rid of the XXL size pants similar by another company that are too short for his height.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States June 25, 2019', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Nice quality', 'author': 'Katelyn Grimes', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Very good quality of pants. Ordered these for my dad and he said he absolutely loves them! Very comfy!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 2, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Only True Summer Running Pants', 'author': 'DJW', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'These are the only true summer pants I could find. They are sold under various names by different sellers, but are all the same. The key difference is the size charts are all different. This seller had the closest sizes to US standard. I am 5\'10", waist 34 and the medium fit almost perfect. They were a little long but with my shoes on I had no issues. I use these for trail running where I want leg protection from brush. I tried another type of "summer" pants that actually fit perfect, but they were more like regular jogging pants: too heavy for the summer. I bought a second pair because I know it is hard to find true summer pants that fit.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States May 9, 2022', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars Clingy and made me feel hot', 'author': 'DBZ', 'rating': 3, 'content': 'These were light weight and thin but they did not feel breathable or cool at all. I put them on and they clung to my legs and made me feel hot.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 4, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Very comfortable', 'author': 'Amazon Customer', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'The husband wants more of them.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 20, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Ridiculously Comfortable, Keeps Me Warm in the Cold', 'author': 'Jessica', 'rating': 5, 'content': "These are the most comfortable pants I have every owned! I saw the cold weather coming, and I hate wearing jeans. They are just so heavy and tight for me. Since I work from home permanently, I don't care how presentable I am. I wear these every single day. Don't judge me, but I find myself wearing them all day and then going to bed with them on because they are so comfy.I like the zippers on the pockets. A lot of exercise pants are so loose and flowy that the contents of the pockets can easily fall out. The zippers just make sure everything is secure.I haven't had a chance to test out their water resistance. But I have worn them out in the cold a lot. I take daily walks, and it's already winter here. I don't wear anything under or over these pants, and my legs stay just fine. They may get a little cold, but not nearly as cold as my exposed face or hands might get. They totally block out the wind. I haven't yet tried them out in real snow play, but I'm sure they won't be that amazing to be used alone. I'll definitely need some sort of snow pants to go with them.I loved these so much that I got 3 colors, and I wear them all the time. They may even be light enough to comfortably wear in the summer. But we'll have to wait for that assessment. I use them for sleeping, doing yoga, or regular daily use. I think I have now found my go-to pants. Peace out, jeans!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 7, 2020', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Good look', 'author': 'greg', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Very comfortable, yet attractive.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 1, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great for workout', 'author': 'Joe Goob', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'A little long but maybe they should be for working out in', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 9, 2023', 'is_verified': True}]

The warmth they provide is ideal for cooler days, yet they don't become overly hot indoors, making them versatile for various climates and settings.The high-waisted design serves dual purposes. Aesthetically, it adds a modern touch to the classic jogger look. Functionally, it provides a snug fit that ensures the pants stay in place whether I'm out on a walk, doing a light workout, or simply lounging at home. This feature, coupled with the adjustable waistband, ensures a fit that can be tailored to personal comfort.Another noteworthy aspect is the stitching. The length hit a tad below my ankles, but they could shrink a little; I\'m not sure. I had no choice but to return them. As for the fabric quality, it\'s very soft, but it does feel a bit more like polyester than cotton. I really want 100% cotton sweat pants, but they are almost impossible to find anymore. These sweat pants do deserve four stars, though. I can\'t stand visible zigzag/serged stitching that\'s on absolutely everything. It\'s a cheap way to sew clothes and these days it\'s on the outside, which I find to be unattractive and also vulnerable to snagging. title: Women's Cargo Hiking Pants Elastic Waist Quick Dry Lightweight Outdoor Water Resistant UPF 50+ Long Pants Zipper
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Comfort and utility', 'author': 'Tammy L Harter', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I'm 5/9 and have a belly and a big booty. These fit me so well. I usually wear 18 in pants. I ordered XXL to give me more room as I don't like them too tight and I like the fit. I bought some Mocoly capris last year and loved them. I'm still using them, but I wanted full length for my upcoming trip to Alaska. I use these when I'm traveling, hiking, or doing other outdoor activities, and I also just wear them aroung the house. They are cool and lightweight. I am bringing some thin leggins to wear under them when needed in Alaska as they won't keep your legs warm on their own. They have a little stretch but they are not stretch pants. The elastic back portion of the waist keeps them comfortable and snug without being too tight. I like the zippered pockets and they dry so fast. When traveling, I can wash them out in the sink with detergent at night and wear them the next day. The material is thin and soft but sturdy. I've worn these on trails, and they still look great a year later.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States June 16, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars I am on my third pair. Love them!', 'author': 'Practigal', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I love the lightweight and quick drying, the loose, comfortable fit, and all the pockets. The material is so lightweight that I can comfortably wear them on a hot day to protect my skin from bugs and the sun. They move easily and comfortably with my body when hiking or speed walking, but are also flattering enough to wear to an outdoor rock concert to take advantage of all the nice pockets. The pockets zip up too, so you have that extra layer of protection for your valuables. The quality is good but I use them so frequently and just bought my third pair. They are my favorite summer activity pants. I even impromptu swam in them last summer and by the time I hiked back to my vehicle, they were totally dry.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States July 17, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Nice that they come in petite', 'author': 'JR', 'rating': 4, 'content': "These pants would be very flattering if they fit my odd body. I liked the contrast zippers and the overall style and I loved that they came in petite. I ordered an XL according to the size chart and while the waist felt great, the seat and legs were very baggy. I probably need a large from the hip down and an XL in the waist. I was also hoping for a bit heavier material, but they certainly would be easily dried if they got wet and great for spring hiking. They would be very comfortable if they fit you well as they are extremely light weight. Another interesting observation, these are the same pants that Baeleaf sells, but Baeleaf doesn't offer the petite version. I know because I ordered a pair from Baeleaf only to realize they were identical except for the sizing.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 24, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Awesome!', 'author': 'Laura', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I LOVE these pants. I work in a very hot warehouse, bending, pushing, pulling, lifting... these pants are lightweight breathable and comfortable. They dont stick, lots of room to breathe and even wearing black sitting in the sun one afternoon. I noticed they didn't draw in the heat and make me bake. They stayed cool. I bought an xxl to be loose and comfortable at work. I gained Covid year weight and want to hide my belly, until I lose it. They look huge holding them up and even in a mirror at first glance but actually fall nicely; with a tank top and tshirt they look like nice loosely styled pants. They have a good draw string to adjust to your waist size and cinch them in. The pockets are deep. I just ordered the camouflage one-size down because I was afraid of going too large with a pattern. I tried them on they fit perfect... can't wait to try them at work. Just practicing bending and what not, I still feel like the pants moved with me and were comfortable even though they are one size down. For a dressier nice casual sleeker pant look... order them to fit. If you like the loose look... a tank top with some compression pulled in my mid-section where you couldn't tell the xxl was big foe me and both sizes hang nice in the rear... so your choice to wear in size or loose. *Navy will be my next color... I think I will be owning quite a few pair... I would probably go true to size on the lighter colors just because those colors aren't as slimming as darker ones. Evcen if I lose weight as I go along here, I know I will still be able to wear these because of the drawstring and the way it can be styled. Eventually, I will like get the longer pants and give them a try for winter. Happy shopping to you! *Update: Super comfortable still in either size (but I have decided I like the XL more than the XXL; I get so many compliments on them!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States July 25, 2021', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great hiking pants, Vuori dupes', 'author': 'Susan Roberts-cooper', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I bought these for a hiking trip to Utah in July, it was hot! These pants are super comfortable and light, easy to wear, and have lots of pockets for all the things you need on the trail, they were perfect for the heat and so lightweight but strong and protective, better than shorts for walking through woodland. The material and cut are similar to a Vuori pair I have which were 3x the price. I am 5‚Äô4‚Äù and 145lbs and bought black, medium, perfect fit.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States July 30, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars OK but..', 'author': 'L', 'rating': 3, 'content': "I bought a few of these in different colors and sizes. I had no idea whether a medium or a large or XL would fit me. I had no idea if the sizing was American standards so I decided to get different sizes and colors to see which one would suit me best. Often, in foreign sizing standards, L or even XL is too small. The sizing turned out to be very much like American standards. The size medium fit best, but though I liked the lightweight fabric and the elastic comfort waist, one problem was the pockets. Oh they were roomy and had zippers which is great actually but this style has a cargo pocket on the left leg and though it does not bellow out like the cargo pockets of military pants or tactical pants, the zipper is at a location so that when you swing your arms along your sides as you walk, your left hand will constantly be coming against the zipper pull (unless your arms are short enough). Also though the pants would be good for exercising in, or going to the gym, or biking, or jogging, or going camping etc, they had a bit too much of a baggy fit on me and the material was too much like knit material that sags and it would not have been versatile enough for general use. Also it was a little too long on me. I don't know about the long term durability, or how it stands up to regular washing or whether it is quick dry. I regretted that I had to send all the ones I ordered back. They were not right enough for me. I don't know if I might be able to use one at a later time.I would still recommend them if you are of the right dimensions or height. Do not hesitate to try them just because I say they were not exactly what I was looking for. They are comfortable and SEEM to be good to wear on a long flight or bus ride if you travel. They would even be good to sleep in though the zippers might feel odd. These pants have four relatively long zippers on the two, regular, side pockets, on the back pocket, and on the left-leg cargo pocket.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States June 26, 2020', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Cool and airy', 'author': 'CJ', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Bought these for a February trip to Costa Rica in Nuevo Arenal where the temperatures are cooler. title: 4-Way Stretch Pants for Women Tall 31" Athletic Trousers with Pockets
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars I just LOVE these pants!', 'author': 'Joiabela', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I wear workout clothes 85% of the time, so I hate wearing jeans or pants. But when I travel, I really feel like I shouldn\'t wear workout clothes (and be THAT American), so I needed some decent looking slacks. I love the NOGA pants from Duluth, but didn\'t really want to spend $90 on them, so I took a chance and ordered these in black. They were perfect for travel...comfortably, stretchy (but don\'t stretch out of shape), easy on/off, and easy to wash in a sink. I also have freakishly long legs and usually struggle getting pants that actually reach my ankles, so I bought the "tall" size expecting the worst and they are plenty long! In fact, when I ordered a second pair (in mineral brown) I probably could have ordered the regular length.I\'m 5\'6", usually a 33" inseam, wear a size 12 and ordered the XL/tall. They are fairly roomy (and as i mentioned, long) so I could have gotten away with a L/average, but I like them roomy).These are awesome slacks, especially for the price. If you\'re hesitating, go ahead and order them. I will be ordering more in other colors.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 19, 2022', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Relaxed, yet slim fit. I\'ve ordered 5 of them!I\'m 5\'7" 110-112 lbs. These are size small tall.I love the rise and the inseam. I wasn\'t looking for anything skin tight- the leggings as pants look. But regular trousers were not slim enough. I needed an in-between. This fits that need for me. The material is light and has a "silky" feeling on my skin, especially with shaved legs :)But the\'ye not shiny. The smallest hint of a shimmer maybe, but not the way silk or satin shimmers... It\'s milder than that.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States June 10, 2022', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars The best', 'author': 'Amazon Customer', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'These are true to size. title: Men's Open-Bottom Sports Pants Sweatpants Trousers Front Zip Fly Closure
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Comfort, sizing, colorfast, non-shrinking.', 'author': 'Hank Stanton', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I bought three pair of these, one in each of colors available. These are good quality, unlike the brand I used to buy. They fit, using sizing chart on site, without having a "standard" length size of about 40\' inseam, regardless of the waist size you order! They\'re a bit thick, but not uncomfortably so, I wore them shopping today in outdoors temp of 92F without getting sweat running down inside them. Really like the zippered fly and pockets (except for the rear pocket). The rear pocket, only available on the right hip, has a small buttonI find difficult to close, and is rather small. as my wallet sticks somewhat above the top of the pocket. Not a game changer for me, as the zippered front pockets are nicely sized and hold my wallet and keys without bulging out.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States July 26, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Seems to be well made, and good warmth', 'author': 'Don', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'Especially like the zipper fly, makes it much easier to go. Only downside is the legs are to long for my xl waistline', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 20, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars The Holy Grail of Sweatpants for work and play', 'author': 'mt yogi', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Second Update 8.21.19Wearing the same pants now in 80 and 90 degree temperates. Still comfortable. They are like denims. Wear them in cold weather or hot weather. The first pant was finally washed after four months of everyday use! Machine wash on Delicate cycle with the pants folded inside out. Then hang dry. Perfect after a few hours, brand as new and ready for another four months. No pilling has occurred and yes the pants retain their shape perfectly. I have not ironed them after washing and no wrinkles show up. I purchase four of these.I also purchased one light weight and I think they are somewhat similar to slim pajama pants in look, feel and structure. The lightweight version can be worn for Yoga, casual evenings or around the house or in bed.A gem of a find. This is an absolutely fantastic product. Touchwood.End of Second update 8.21.19Update 2.12.19 Been wearing these awesome pants now for 3 weeks. Everyday. Everywhere. Have been wearing them to work. They hold great in temperature from 40s to 60s. Did not feel cold or warm. Big Plus - no wrinkles... The shape is holding great. Wear them to the gym and on the treadmill. Buying groceries and dinners. These are just fantastic wear everywhere every day pants. A great find for everyone and especially for minimalists. Ordered a new pair again in Thick Dark Grey. Requested Zoulee by email to introduce more colors which they responded back saying they would soon. This has turned out to be one of the best comfortable products I have bought in many years.End of Update 2.12.19For the past many years I have been looking for Sweatpants that are (a) Good Quality (b) Comfort fit with some good room in the crotch area, i.e. moderate to high rise instead of the sickening low rise pants that have half the world showing their bottom crack in sitting positions (c) Has Front Fly Zipper (d) Can wear to WorkThe few I found in the market were either very poor quality or extremely expensive. I had been passing through this Zoulee\'s sweatpant page quite a few times, but the kind of sizing they displayed for this product made me skeptical, but in the end decided to give it a try.I ordered the M size for my waist size of 35". Something didn\'t seem right, so I emailed Zoulee and they immediately replied back that they will swap the size as the S size would be the better fit for me.The pants came in this morning (a few weeks later) and I am very very impressed. Sweat pants quality? Check, Awesome Mix of Cotton and Nylon with some stretch in the fabric. Comfort fit? Check. It has enough room in the rise to comfortably sit high on my waist. Snug fit at the waist and comfort straight fit down below. Wear to Work? Check. They simply drape like a regular formal pant - I think the nylon and the way the fabric is cut does the trick. Bonus points: They don\'t wrinkle in the few hours I have worn them like cotton or linenAnd finally Fly Front Zipper? BIG CHECK. Yes, these pants DO HAVE ZIPPER FLY. The other two reviews said "no zipper fly" so I emailed Zoulee again to make sure these pants had zipper fly. They replied back confirming their pants hat front fly zipper and were helpless and did not understand why two reviewers said their pants did not have zippers. I felt sorry for Zoulee and more so now, seeing the super quality of their pants and the fact that they do have zipper front fly.Will update this review in a few months to see how the quality of pant survives the wear and tear and look for pilling etc.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 27, 2019', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '1.0 out of 5 stars The fit, different from the other pants that I had purchased from you.', 'author': 'Amazon Customer', 'rating': 1, 'content': 'I did not like the fit, bought about five pair in 3 years, the last pair the legs were very wide and the length was longer witch will require alterations.I don‚Äôt know why , I ordered the same size and same style and the same color. I don‚Äôt think I‚Äôll be ordering this again.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 18, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Very nice!', 'author': 'Queenlovebug', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'My husband is very satisfied with this product! I have a bunch of colors in the other styles as well', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States August 23, 2022', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars OV Rec Trek dupe', 'author': 'Jamie Jo Johnson', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I love the fit of these pants and they feel just like the outdoor voices rec treks!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 27, 2022', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Great material', 'author': 'Mia', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'I got True Navy color and it looks more like black in person. The material is exactly what I expected (the buttery soft gym clothing material) and it was slightly thicker than I expected which was good. They don\'t look out work out pants because the back looks like regular pants and there is no drawstring.The pockets have no zips even though the listing title mentioned zips. They do tend to bend outwards a little when you sit down so it might feel awkward, but a lot of pants this style do that so not a deal breaker. Also, the right pocket actually has a divider that you can use to separate small things! The pants have 3 functional pockets which I love.There is a SMALL logo below the knees on the left side which I\'m not really happy about but the pants are dark enough so it\'s hard to tell there is a logo unless you look really close.I\'m planning to wear these casually and for work. The length hits my ankles which is a bit longer than I expected for 26" inseam (usually it hits just above my ankles). I got size S for a slight loose fit but XS would\'ve worked if they stretch out a bit.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States June 29, 2022', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars very high waisted', 'author': 'Nicole', 'rating': 4, 'content': "I love the material of these pants- you can dress these up or down. I think these were a little too high waisted for me though (they go a couple of inches above my belly button), so if you have a smaller torso like me you may not want to order.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States September 1, 2022', 'is_verified': True}]

title: Men's Lightweight Sweatpants Loose Fit Open Bottom Mesh Athletic Pants with Zipper Pockets
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Good purchase', 'author': 'Amazon Customer', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Good quality , light weight , very comfortable . Love the style', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 4, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Was worried about size, but it fits well when I received it.', 'author': 'Kenny', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Was worried about size when ordering, but it fits really well. Light, comfortable and nothing to complain so far.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 18, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Great looking but too long.', 'author': 'James', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'These feel like someone took a bunch of thin red silk napkins and made sweatpants from them. I wouldn\'t recommend wearing these out in cold weather, I live in Buffalo NY and can say that from personal experience. But they look great and are very comfortable with 2 small zip up pockets. I am 5\' 11" and weigh 254 LBS and the 2XXL pants fit great, but the legs are very long so make sure to wear only high-top sneakers or you will drag the bottoms on the ground and ruin them.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 1, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great Lightweight Sweatpants', 'author': 'Deb B.', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I bought this sweatpants for my husband for Christmas. They look terrific and he said that they are very comfortable.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 20, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great for the heat', 'author': 'Futureboy', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I live in Austin and need a thin, cool comfy pant to slip on when taking the dog out-- shorts don\'t work because of the mosquitos-- and this is just what I was looking for. Love the selection too. I\'ll be buying a few more. NOTE: There is an issue with what I call "outlining" (gents, you may know what I\'m referring to). Good news is I found a product on Amazon that takes care of that https://www.amazon.com/dp/B0899L1BHF?psc=1&ref=ppx_yo2ov_dt_b_product_details (Sorry if that\'s not allowed, but I feel like this product is essential for wearing these pants-- just trying to help!)', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 26, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars Amazing material, comfortable, WEIRD SIZING', 'author': 'Autumn Smith, Kindle Customer', 'rating': 3, 'content': 'First, I‚Äôd like to start off with the pants have amazing material. They are also wicking, very light and breathable. The pockets are a neat touch and they seem durable. I haven‚Äôt tested the pockets out fully yet, but so far so good, I‚Äôll edit if otherwise.So why did I give it only 3 stars versus 5? It might be a little harsh, but hear me out, the main reason we all shop online is because we don‚Äôt want to deal with stores and changing rooms, amiright!? So we all try our hardest to ensure we have the right size in order to avoid returns. Sure, Amazon has an amazing return policy and system, but it‚Äôs still a hassle we as customers should be able to avoid as much as possible. So it‚Äôs very crucial as a clothing company to ensure you have an accurate size chart/guide and that is not the case here. Let‚Äôs pretend that it doesn‚Äôt have a weird funky listing of the ‚ÄúBrand‚Äùs sizes vs the US that aren‚Äôt even listed in the options such as 3XL-6XL (this is clearly not the brand sizes they are selling) and let‚Äôs just focus on the listed US sizes. Those sizes are not accurate. If you look at the transition of the waist inches they are only roughly an inch difference. Look at any other size guide on a normal clothing website and this is not the case. Already it looks suspicious. But hey I decided to take a shot at it anyway!I am 5‚Äô9, 270 pounds, and my measurements are 43 waist, 53 hip, and 32 inseam and I was able to get the XX-L and they are actually very fitting. In a rough comparison I would be a 3XL in Addidas and Nike pants for women, for example. The size chart is completely wacko. According to them I should not be able to even step into that size. Hopefully they see this and update that, because honestly I‚Äôve seen it so many times on Amazon now that I‚Äôm starting to think it‚Äôs the site.Also, some have complained of it being way too long. I haven‚Äôt had this issue, but I don‚Äôt wear them below my crotch like some guys do. I wear them roughly halfway between my waist and my hips. I could still wear them on my hips, but the pants are slightly, only slightly longer than usual( I personally like this) so they would almost hit the floor, but not quite.I highly recommend them if you can translate your size through reviews and I would buy them again, I just think I got lucky with my sizing, but I don‚Äôt think it should be a guessing game, I consider that playing with customers‚Äô time and money, so hence the three stars.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States April 23, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Very comfortable!!', 'author': 'Fred', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I was honestly super worried I was gonna end up with a size too small or too big or something but no! These are great!!Zipper pockets are also very great :)', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 29, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars go with size chart: the Small White (2023) is the same size as my original Large Black (2021)', 'author': 'Chinarut', 'rating': 4, 'content': "bottom line, we decided to keep these pants but to be honest, we would have been happier if we paid $15 max for them.UPDATE (July 12, 2023): it's been two years & I love these pants - I don't travel without them! I'm happy to say the elastic has gotten much looser to the point im not complaining how tight they are (in fact, reading my review from 2 years ago shocked me- totally forgotten as they fit well right now!). I don't recall if I ever bothered hemming the leg cuffs - I think I just decided to live with it & happy to say that I don't see any tears stepping on the extra length from time to time like my last pair of dance pants. So all in all, if it says anything, I just bought another pair in white & was happy to pay $20 on Prime Day (though $15 would have been better, I am satisfied with my first pair given the abuse they've been through!). Never done this before & adding a star as this is 5 stars for those of you that have slim bodies like me - you'll be plenty happy!UPDATE (July 19, 2023): bumping back down to 4 stars - sizing is inconsistent across colors (see photos). in the mismatched photo, the black one is the one I bought 2 years ago that fits great. I got my 2nd pair today and you can see how much bigger it is. they are *both* large. reached out to seller to resolve this. very frustrating.UPDATE (July 24, 2023): a total of 6 purchases later and 4 returns, I've discovered my original Large Black (from 2021) is the *same* size as my Small White (2nd photo, 2023). Now the good news is I think over the past 2 years, they've gotten the actual size of the pants to match the sizing chart (so trust the sizing chart now! #yeay). so I'm just gonna chaulk this up as progress on behalf of the company. I love both my pants at the end of the day - they are super comfy & practical! leaving the rest of my review for context & impressions from 2021The biggest issue is the horrendous sizing. I am completely shocked given how skinny I am - I have a 28-29‚Äù waist and I‚Äôm 5‚Äô7‚Äù tall - the size chart says ‚Äú30.7-34.6‚Äù and what BS! I exchanged sizes twice to Medium and Large (33.0-37.0‚Äù) and it is still too tight! The real fault in the design is there are pull strings and they failed to make the elastic *loose* and let you use the drawstrings to take up for the slack (this is how my other pair of sweatpants with elastic work)on top of that, the length of the pants are too long - Small was too long and by the time I got to Large to help ease up on the waist, it‚Äôs even longer. Now I need to go through the trouble of hemming the length (which is doable - just prefer not to have had to go through the trouble)It really dumbfounds me for garments made in China, that these do not fit a typical Asian build (I‚Äôve done a lot of shopping in Thailand for clothes) - I can‚Äôt imagine these pants being comfortable for a typical American build - you‚Äôll be lucky if XL feels comfortable on you.Other than that, I like the material, it‚Äôs lightweight, dries fast and I got them because I am a dancer so I wanted my dance stripes (though these are super subtle - I kinda wish they had the standard white stripe on black (they only have black stripes on white) - so be it) and the one must have feature are zippered pockets - i absolutely can‚Äôt stand loosing car keys, wallet, etc with standard athletic pants when you sit down!I can‚Äôt wait for this elastic to go bad - it‚Äôs just so *tight* even with the drawstrings untied! (UPDATE: good news is the elastic breaks in after a year)", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States July 9, 2021', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Perfect for teen', 'author': 'Cathy Sees', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'My 17 only likes to wear sweat pants to school, but I do not like home to look sloppy. These are sweat pants and look, sharp and nice fitting.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 6, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Exactly what I was looking for', 'author': 'Bill', 'rating': 4, 'content': "Extremely light weight and smooth with absolutely no construction of movement. Great looking as well but I can't give them 5 stars because there no black and yellow options ü§£", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 22, 2024', 'is_verified': True}]

title: BROKIG Mens Zip Joggers Pants - Casual Gym Workout Track Pants Comfortable Slim Fit Tapered Sweatpants with Pockets
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Good looking and comfortable', 'author': 'Pugaloo', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I ordered this for my husband after he saw an ad for something similar that cost a lot more money on social media. These worked out great! Snug ankles that don‚Äôt bag, roomy and comfortable everywhere else, trendy and stylish to boot! He wears them to the gym and out and about. He liked them so much we just ordered another pair.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 27, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars My favorite thin jogger. Some colors look better than other.', 'author': 'Scott', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I recently purchased the BROKIG Mens Zip Joggers Pants and I have mostly positive feelings about them. While the fit is great and the material is comfortable, the color options are a little hit and miss.I found that for some reason, the grey colors look way better than the red, yellow, blue, and other options.On the positive side, the fit of these pants is great, especially if you have slightly thicker legs like I do. The waistband and cuffs have just the right amount of elasticity, ensuring a snug but comfortable fit. The zippers on the ankles are great for changing without needing to take off your shoes.Overall, I would recommend the BROKIG Mens Zip Joggers Pants to anyone looking for a comfortable and stylish pair of pants for workouts or casual wear. The grey color options are definitely the best, and the fit is spot-on for those with thicker legs. If you're looking for a reliable pair of pants that will keep you looking and feeling good, these are definitely worth checking out.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States April 24, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Great deal on these when purchased since gone up in price!', 'author': 'batchcorps', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'Overal for the money great no complaints.I am a big 6\'1" tall and 230lb man.They fit very snugly I purchased the largest size available and they fit snug.They give they feel comfortable and i like that the legs are very slim; no material flapping anywhere.Good value but tight fitting.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 17, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Not too skinny, not too baggy, they‚Äôre perfect!!!!!!', 'author': 'Manuel Torres', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I‚Äôm 5‚Äô7‚Äù tall, 190 lbs and I was looking for a jogger to wear to the gym. I didn‚Äôt want super skinny joggers but I also didn‚Äôt want them to be all baggy. These are EXACTLY what I was looking for. They are nice and slim but not skin-tight like some other brands. They‚Äôre ‚Äúslim-loose‚Äù. The material feels premium and they are super comfortable. I‚Äôll definitely order more pairs to wear them to the gym throughout the week.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 3, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars These fit my body perfectly, MOST of the time', 'author': 'zenraged', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I\'m 5\'10 150lbs and very athletically built. I\'ve been buying these in size Large because I feel like they do shrink a bit after a few washes. Also I suspect these pants are designed to fit tight, and I prefer a little extra room to move in.I currently have 5 pairs in Large and a few older pairs in Medium. Sometimes I\'ll receive a pair and the leg length will be shorter than usual. So the consistency of the product can fluctuate. This is rare though, usually they fit the same. I recently ordered the camo color pattern in Large and it fits the same around the waist but the length is definitely shorter than the other size Larges I have. Now that I own multiples of these I\'ll be able to detect right away when I receive a short one and make a return. However, if you\'re buying your first pair and receive one that seems shorter, it may be hard to tell.As I said before I\'m 5\'10" and 150LBS and the Large fits perfect and the length of the legs goes down below my ankle so that the pant legs rest on my shoes and my socks are hidden. When I perform a squat there is enough stretch and length to the pants that they don\'t ride up above my ankles either. That is, except on the camo model that has a shorter leg length. And until I order another camo model I don\'t know if this is due to the color pattern or just a random shorter length pair.These are my favorite pants, I continue to order them. I\'ve tried other variations from this company but these are my favorite.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 29, 2022', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars small is a bit baggy... wish x-small was still available', 'author': 'M', 'rating': 3, 'content': "initial quality seems very good. not sure how well it'll hold up after a few washes, but I can't find any flaws or QC issues out of the package which is great. i like the style and the fit, but small is a bit baggy. I was able to get an x-small a year ago-ish, but x-small doesn't ever seem to be in stock or the company stopped making them which is bad.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 8, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great Product..', 'author': 'Armando', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Perfect joggers. I‚Äôm 6‚Äô and 195 pounds with a 34-36 waist. Large is a great fit. Material is comfortable and surprisingly keeps me warm. Wasn‚Äôt sure because they are thinner than typical cotton sweats. Bought 2 and planning on 2 more colors now that I‚Äôve tried these with great results.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 5, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great fit', 'author': 'Amazon Customer', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Wasn‚Äôt sure my grandson would like the style and he did.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 15, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Perfect', 'author': 'Robert R. Pecoraro', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Form fitting sweats that look a little sexy I think. I do not workout in these. For me they are pants I wear with my regular clothes. I have received compliments when I wear these. Maybe I look good. Either that they noticeably look better then the other stuff I wear. Probably a little of both. üòÇ', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 9, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars way more that I expected', 'author': 'victor mendoza', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Nice quality, nice fit, I really like this product', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 5, 2024', 'is_verified': True}]

reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Attractive and easy care, wear anywhere', 'author': 'Dav', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'These sweatpants met all my expectations and then some. The materials feel above average but not the softest material if you are going to lounge or work out in them, as they don\'t feel as "breathable" as similar pants and jogger I own. The color matches the pics and description. I typically wear a 33-34 waist but these size 32 pants felt like they are 34-36 waist so be mindful of that. I don\'t think they will shrink much, if at all, but the extra long waist string will be able to tighten pretty good. The pockets other than the back pockets are well placed and deep. The back feels like they could have been placed about and inch or 2 lower. The ankle elastics are tough and grab onto the ankles with no sag. You have your choice of many colors and khaki option looks crisp and clean.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 22, 2024', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Nice fit and comfy too!', 'author': 'Alan H.', 'rating': 5, 'content': "These might be a slight bit smaller than expected, but I sized up just to be safe. They fit well and are quite comfortable. They wash and wear well and I haven't noticed any shrinkage.The drawstring does it's job for compensating for the sizing and they stay put well...until you put a bunch of stuff in the pockets. Gravity will take over at that point.Id say these are a great deal, especially at the price!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 2, 2024', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars Did Anyone Test This Design?', 'author': 'Trevor', 'rating': 3, 'content': 'The good: These look nice. If you think they look good on the model, you\'ll probably like how they look in person.The bad: Everything else. The fit on these is in my opinion, terribly accurate. What this means is, you order the 32 Regular, that\'s exactly what it will fit. So if you\'re like me, and have a body that is not perfectly proportional, you will want to base your size choice on your legs, not your waist. I wear 32x34 pants, and these legs are 100% made for a 32 inch inseam. They go down to my ankle only when perfectly straight, so once I do that crazy thing called "walking," they ride up my shins a few inches. And on the subject of the ankles, somehow Coofandy found the only version I\'ve seen of polyester that doesn\'t stretch, so when trying to take these off, the ankles barely open enough to get around my foot. When wearing socks I can either choose to take them off first to make it easier, or they\'re just going to come off in the process anyways.My last gripe is Sky Blue, since you may be thinking "I\'m sure the picture is just taken in dark place," but no, the choice called Sky Blue looks exactly that shade of "blue." Its possible this is a London-based company, and that\'s just what they think the sky looks like, but in my world that\'s Blue-grey. In the end though, the color being labeled weirdly is the least of my problems with these. The thing about clothes that look nice but fit poorly/uncomfortably, is I\'m the one that has to wear them; everyone else gets to "enjoy" them more than me, since all they have to do is see them, not be in them. Mediocre at best is all I can give these, so a 3/5 seems reasonable. If you can find other brands for a similar price that look to be as appealing to you/more so, I\'d say go with them instead.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 25, 2024', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Comfortable!', 'author': 'samgn', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'It was a no-brainer to give these Cargo Pants 5 stars. The material is soft and will shed wrinkles, also repelling water if you get caught in the rain. Several features attracted me: the stitching is neat and attractive. The first photo is looking at a back pocket. In the second photo, notice the subtle gathers near the waistband. This keeps them neat, but not too tight. By the way, there is no zipper; that overlapped fabric is just a faux fly. Finally, I‚Äôm really impressed by the roomy cargo pockets and that they close with heavy duty snaps. I have been seeing a lot of this brand here on Amazon and can understand their popularity. I will enjoy these pants!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 17, 2024', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Super nice! Very well made!', 'author': 'Kelley Rogers', 'rating': 5, 'content': "My dad absolutely loves these pants. They aren't too heavy and fit very well! All the pockets are great. Plenty of places to put all of your belongings. They are made very well. The seams are sewn together nicely and I have no doubt these will hold up for a long time. They keep their color and shape after washing and drying as well. I really like that they aren't stiff like so many of these type are. They are just really nice pants!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 21, 2024', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Stylish and lighweight', 'author': 'Long Beach Shopper', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'These are much more lightweight than I expected - they almost remind me of a nylon material, but they are a bit stretchy. reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars High-quality pants, great for out & about', 'author': '84848', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I ended up ordering 10 pairs of lounge pants from Amazon. I swear, it wasn‚Äôt intentional. I was looking for a lightweight lounge pant for fall and late spring in the northeast. I ordered 4 pairs at first and was disappointed by all of them, so I ordered more. Thankfully my next batch had winners. Here are my reviews and rankings.(1st Place) Ritiriko Women's Joggers with Pockets, High Waist Yoga Capri Pants for Running Workout Lounge: My favorites! I pulled these out of the bag and I thought they would be too tight and small. The waist was the perfect fit and it managed to be fitted without feeling tight. The material isn‚Äôt cozy or super soft but it is smooth and very comfortable.(2nd Place) SPECIALMAGIC Sweatpants Lounge Wear for Women Ankle Length Loose Fit Casual Pants Baggy Workout Active Cropped: My second favorites! I am 5‚Äô4‚Äù and these hit me right at my ankle but could also be pulled up. These were SO SOFT and the waistband was comfortably loose. These are a lower-quality dupe for Boody Eco Wear lounge pants. I actually returned the Boodys because for $60+ I expected something softer. Something like this! Of course, Boody‚Äôs lounge pants are made of bamboo and sustainable, whereas these are rayon, so, of course not ideal, but so dang comfy and only $20. Also, I think these look a little better on than pictured. I got it in black.(3rd Place) Yogipace Petite/Regular/Tall Women's 7/8 On The Fly Pants Drawstring Casual Lounge Joggers Travel Sweatpants: I reaaaally liked these. At 5‚Äô4‚Äù the 27‚Äù length was perfect. These had a little more weight than most other pants. Very sturdy waistband. If you don‚Äôt like cozy soft and prefer a smooth, heavier soft (hope that makes sense), these will be good for you. These are nylon. The waistband on these was pretty loose and there‚Äôs lots of slack in the drawstrings for adjustment. You might want to consider sizing down, and you definitely want to if you have a small waist.Amazon Brand - Core 10 Women's Yoga CoreCloud Fleece Jogger: These were a great, comfy, cozy, fleece-lined lounge pant but were too warm for what I was looking for. These would be great in the winter. I didn‚Äôt keep them because I already have winter lounge pants. Very similar to the Ann Taylor LOFT Outlet Super Soft line. The price point is about the same if you watch LOFT Outlet sales. I prefer the LOFT Outlet style because they are cozier and the waistband is thick and high-rise.KEEPBEAUTY Womens Active Yoga Sweatpants Loose Workout Joggers Pants Comfy Lounge Pants with PocketsANDDIBAOLONG Womens Yoga Pants Wide Leg Loose Drawstring Comfy Lounge Workout Sweatpants with Pockets Cameo M^ These are the same! The exact same, folks. Lol. So the material of these was suuuuper soft and cozy, lightweight, loved it. The catch was the waistband. I found it a little tight and uncomfortable. And it didn‚Äôt have a drawstring to loosen. This wasn‚Äôt a sizing issue, because the legs were loose even on my thick thighs. If you have a slim waist you should def get these. If you don‚Äôt you might want to avoid.CRZ YOGA Women's Stretch Lounge Sweatpants Travel Ankle Drawstring 7/8 Athletic Track Yoga Dress Pants: These seemed to be high-quality and were very comfortable without being cozy soft. I definitely wondered if I could get away with wearing these to the office; they were very flattering. These would be perfect for wearing over short shorts or a bathing suit in the winter on the way to the gym or studio. I am not keeping them for lounge purposes.Sarin Mathews Womens Yoga Pants Pleated Wide Leg Loose Comfy Lounge Pants Workout Sweatpants for Women with Pockets: These are a really soft, comfortable material and fit beautifully. You could totally get away with wearing these to the office. If you practice yoga and don‚Äôt like how fitted typical yoga pants are, these are a great alternative. I don‚Äôt think the model photo does these pants justice. Watch the product video to see how they really look. Again, though, they were tight in the waist for me. I don‚Äôt mind this amount of tightness when I am out and about but I wanted something looser for lounge. I could have sized up but the pant legs were already a tad too long on me.BALEAF EVO Women's Skinny Cotton Joggers Sweatpants Tapered Casual Lounge Jogging Pants Fitted Yoga Workout Pocketed PantsANDBALEAF Women's Cotton Sweatpants Cozy Joggers Pants Tapered Active Yoga Lounge Casual Travel Pants with Pockets^ Again these are the EXACT same thing. Even though I ordered these in the same size, one arrived with an inch larger waistband than the other. I don‚Äôt know which one is which because other than that they are identical, so, sorry, can‚Äôt advise as to which one you should get if you want the larger waistband. Lol! I would wish you luck in figuring it out, but honestly, these aren‚Äôt great. The material is rough and the seams are unattractive. The Amazon joggers are a much better buy.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 18, 2020', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Comfy and pass for business casual', 'author': 'dilli', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I found these pants very comfortable and a great length for me at 5\'8" to wear as an ankle pant, stopping at the right height to wear with ankle booties for work. title: Women's Pants with Deep Pockets 7/8 Stretch Ankle Sweatpants for Golf, Athletic, Lounge, Travel, Work
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars The best travel pant for your money', 'author': 'BMR', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I cannot imaging paying hundreds of dollars for a similar pant in a different brand. I have 3 pairs of joggers from this brand and decided to try the ankle pant for traveling. I am glad I did. They are a slight step up from the joggers in looking less casual. The olive color is deep and really pretty. I love the fit, I am usually a size 12/14 and bought the XL for a roomier fit in thighs and length. I don't think a Large would have been as comfortable, more clingy than i prefer. We are traveling to a warmer climate and these are going to be breathable and cool for when we land.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 13, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Nice fabric great fit', 'author': 'Brenda', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'These pants are not for you if you are looking for the length to go past your ankle. They fall slightly above ankle. They are comfortable with a nice fabric and wide elastic band, very deep pockets. I purchased size M and am 5‚Äô5‚Äù 145 lbs.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 23, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Comfy!', 'author': 'K', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'I got these in the color BLACK in a size LARGE. For sizing reference, I\'m usually a medium-large or a 8-12/29-31 in bottoms and jeans. If it helps, I wear a size 6 or 8 in Lulu leggings. I\'m 5\'3" tall with a short torso, and my measurements are about 44"-33"-44" (bust-waist-hip) right now, give or take.I found these to be mostly TTS, though I\'d recommend potentially sizing up if you have larger hips/butt. I still had plenty of room but would potentially size up to an XL if I wanted them baggier.The material is super soft and stretchy, more brushed than athletic, though it has a hint of slickness to it. They are super comfortable.The style is interesting, as it looks like it would be a jogger but it\'s cropped instead. I personally hate joggers, so I thought these were a nice change. I have thicker thighs and calves from years of soccer and these were super forgiving in those areas. I\'m a little on the shorter side and found the length was a bit longer than I\'d prefer, but I can just roll them up twice and they\'re perfect, or get them hemmed. In my picture, my left leg has the hem rolled and the right leg does not, so you can see the difference. They hit the top of my foot unrolled.I really like these because they\'re good for running around, working out, or even for casual workwear. I do wish they didn\'t have the logo on the leg and instead had them either on the back of the waistband, and/or made it tonal so it wasn\'t obvious.Overall, I\'d definitely recommend these. I don\'t know if I\'ll grab any other colors, as I don\'t wear this type of thing often, but I still like them.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 22, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Nice pants', 'author': 'Amazon Customer', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Great pair of golf pants that are great value, durability and comfortable', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 26, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Love these pants', 'author': 'Josh Fromme', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I have these in 3 colors and I love them so much! reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars i wish i got them sooner', 'author': 'Anita', 'rating': 5, 'content': '(This might be recency bias but I‚Äôll update at the end of sweatpants season)Right when I put them on I fell in love. I still struggle to dress myself sometimes , and need to wear loose fitting clothing to a lot of these appointments also to access my affected discs and nerve. which helped me realize I only have one pair of THIN sweatpants and I needed loose fitting pants that were warm, i have to take the bus and it‚Äôs COLD out right now.Theyre so thick, soft, and comfortable; I slept in them and they kept me super warm in 37ish degrees with wind and rain on my walk to grab a coffee üò≠üíï they‚Äôre not too tight on my stomach either, another bonus as i get nauseous when theres too much pressure on my abdomenI love these em so much I might buy another pair when I can I really hope they do well in their first wash tomorrow.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 2, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Nice pants', 'author': 'Amazon Customer', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'I really liked these pants - seems like good quality and a nice loose fit. The legs terminate in ankle cuffs, so the pants don‚Äôt ride up and they keep vermin off your ankles. The two front pockets are ample, so your cell phone and wallet are safe during exercise. There‚Äôs also a zippered back pocket, which I haven‚Äôt used. I‚Äôm not sure about fake fly, but it does make the pants look more like normal, casual wear. The pants are also equipped with extremely long drawstrings. The waistband is already quite tight, so at this point I don‚Äôt really need to use them. The pants have a feature I haven‚Äôt seen in similar pants. They come with a pair of slots on the inside of the waist band so the drawstring can be threaded on the inside of the waistband. For now, this is what I‚Äôve done and it gives the front of the pants a clean look.I have about a 32‚Äù waist, so I ordered medium pants as recommended on the size chart. The pants fit pretty well, although at times the waistband feels a bit tight. But then again, I like that because I don‚Äôt have to fiddle with the drawstrings. To sum it up, the pants look good, flex with my body, don‚Äôt wrinkle, and have spacy pockets for id and phone-- so perfect for light exercise on a warm day, as well as some casual indoor socializing.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 24, 2023', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Check Measurements Before Ordering', 'author': 'W.
