title: Men's Flex Tactical Pant Lightweight Stretch Work Cargo Pants EDC Casual Trouser Outdoor Sport Hiking Pant
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great looking, high quality pants. Husband Approved!', 'author': 'A to Z', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I ordered these for my husband and he absolutely loves them. He is actually wearing them as I write this!Originally I had in mind that he would utilize these hunting or fishing, but he wears them shopping, shoveling snow and even lounging around the house.He reports that these are very comfortable and especially likes the stretchiness. These fit him very well, and look good on him too. (And he knows it! He joked about all the women checking him out when he picked up milk at the store... sigh!)There are many pockets to store supplies like shells for hunting or tackle for fishing. He says these work pretty well in the cold despite not being insulated, and hold off the wind better than expected.My husband is picky and usually strictly wears jeans, so for him to be so impressed and actually prefer to wear these says a lot!Very well made, great fit and I find do them attractive on him (along with the hordes of women at the grocery store he had to fight off!)For reference I ordered a 34W x 32L. My husband is about 5\'10"ft and 180lbs.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 6, 2024', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Outstanding Versatility & Comfort', 'author': '‚òº', 'rating': 5, 'content': "They're an extremely comfortable pair of pants with a flexible ripstop fabric blend that is tough and both looks and feels amazing, with a great finish that leaves no loose threads or imperfections.The pants themselves feature an elastic waistband and a high-quality zipper that doesn't get stuck or bite on fabric.There are many large Velcro pockets in these pants, as well as a handful of useful smaller pockets.Additionally, lugging tools or keys around is made easy thanks to the two metal loops situated at the front of the pants.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 28, 2024', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Decent, but not perfect', 'author': 'ADM_NW', 'rating': 4, 'content': "These pants are okay. Like the description says, they are definitely lightweight. So don't expect them to stand up to super rough conditions. But should be a good option in warmer climates where you don't need much insulation or abrasion resistance. They do look good and fit well. Nice assortment of pockets to hold most anything. One thing I wasn't impressed with and can sometimes be an indication of the quality was the button hole. It isn't done well at all and the button kept catching on loose threads that were not properly sewn into the material. But overall they seem decent.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 17, 2024', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great tac pants - cut, color and sewing all high quality', 'author': 'White Spruce Tech', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'These IDOGEAR tactical pants are just what you need for your summertime outdoor adventure. These are nicely constructed to protect you being active outside. The sewing is nice and fabric rip-stop and slightly stretchy. There are extra seams to allow your knees to flex and nice elastic in the waist to keep them fitting well under your belt. Generous pockets and "hard points" to connect gear on carabiners or things like knives with belt clips. The color is great too. I chose the dark green and it will work fine for Scout pants.Just the garment you need as essential camping gear.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 31, 2023', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars Too short', 'author': 'treble101', 'rating': 3, 'content': 'Too short, "high water pants". 34Wx32L not good fit for 6\'2" person. Waist fit good, but little wide between top legs/waist area for my taste. Nice color though.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 21, 2023', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Nice quality pants!', 'author': 'Doug', 'rating': 5, 'content': "They fit a little bit small, and don't stretch so keep they in mind when ordering. They have great pockets and are well made", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 14, 2024', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Looks good', 'author': 'Scott Alli P', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'Took a while to get here but they fit good. Great pants and possibly acceptable for school uniforms', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 25, 2023', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Durable and Roomy pockets', 'author': 'Gary H', 'rating': 4, 'content': "These pants and durable and move well. Pockets are good and deep. My iphone, with its waterproof case, fits just fine in the cargo pockets, which I find many cargo pants with pockets too small. As a rock climber, I seek durable stretch pants. These do stretch, but it's not much and it's horizontally, I find vertical stretch better for outdoor activities, especially rock climbing, so I am a bit disappointed by that, so I removed a star from the rating. But for the price, these are a good durable pair of pants.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 16, 2023', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Ample Pockets', 'author': 'Glenn R. Howes', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'Wore these today and they are comfortable, with a good waist flexibility. Material is very polyester-like with water repellency. Like both the pouch pockets on the upper thighs and the smallish pockets on top front. Good places for my phone and utility knife, respectively.Showed a fair amount of residual dye when we went through our custom of soaking new clothes in a basin of fresh water. So avoid washing with whites.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 24, 2023', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great for Hiking, But Mind the Sizing', 'author': 'Klaus Treumann', 'rating': 5, 'content': "Recently got these Flex Tactical Pants for my husband. They're lightweight, stretchy - perfect for outdoor activities.But here's the twist - my husband has put on a bit of weight. So the pants didn't fit him. Disappointing, yes, but not the pants' fault. They seem true to size; just didn't account for the extra pounds.Now, the silver lining - they almost fit me perfectly! I never thought I'd wear men's pants, but here I am, considering taking them for my hiking adventures. The cargo pockets are super practical, and the stretchy fabric is a plus on the trails.So if you're eyeing these pants, double-check the sizing, especially if there's been any recent size changes in your household!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 13, 2023', 'is_verified': False}]

title: BROKIG Mens Zip Joggers Pants - Casual Gym Workout Track Pants Comfortable Slim Fit Tapered Sweatpants with Pockets
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Good looking and comfortable', 'author': 'Pugaloo', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I ordered this for my husband after he saw an ad for something similar that cost a lot more money on social media. These worked out great! Snug ankles that don‚Äôt bag, roomy and comfortable everywhere else, trendy and stylish to boot! He wears them to the gym and out and about. He liked them so much we just ordered another pair.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 27, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars My favorite thin jogger. Some colors look better than other.', 'author': 'Scott', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I recently purchased the BROKIG Mens Zip Joggers Pants and I have mostly positive feelings about them. While the fit is great and the material is comfortable, the color options are a little hit and miss.I found that for some reason, the grey colors look way better than the red, yellow, blue, and other options.On the positive side, the fit of these pants is great, especially if you have slightly thicker legs like I do. The waistband and cuffs have just the right amount of elasticity, ensuring a snug but comfortable fit. The zippers on the ankles are great for changing without needing to take off your shoes.Overall, I would recommend the BROKIG Mens Zip Joggers Pants to anyone looking for a comfortable and stylish pair of pants for workouts or casual wear. The grey color options are definitely the best, and the fit is spot-on for those with thicker legs. If you're looking for a reliable pair of pants that will keep you looking and feeling good, these are definitely worth checking out.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States April 24, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Great deal on these when purchased since gone up in price!', 'author': 'batchcorps', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'Overal for the money great no complaints.I am a big 6\'1" tall and 230lb man.They fit very snugly I purchased the largest size available and they fit snug.They give they feel comfortable and i like that the legs are very slim; no material flapping anywhere.Good value but tight fitting.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 17, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Not too skinny, not too baggy, they‚Äôre perfect!!!!!!', 'author': 'Manuel Torres', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I‚Äôm 5‚Äô7‚Äù tall, 190 lbs and I was looking for a jogger to wear to the gym. I didn‚Äôt want super skinny joggers but I also didn‚Äôt want them to be all baggy. These are EXACTLY what I was looking for. They are nice and slim but not skin-tight like some other brands. They‚Äôre ‚Äúslim-loose‚Äù. The material feels premium and they are super comfortable. I‚Äôll definitely order more pairs to wear them to the gym throughout the week.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 3, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars These fit my body perfectly, MOST of the time', 'author': 'zenraged', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I\'m 5\'10 150lbs and very athletically built. I\'ve been buying these in size Large because I feel like they do shrink a bit after a few washes. Also I suspect these pants are designed to fit tight, and I prefer a little extra room to move in.I currently have 5 pairs in Large and a few older pairs in Medium. Sometimes I\'ll receive a pair and the leg length will be shorter than usual. So the consistency of the product can fluctuate. This is rare though, usually they fit the same. I recently ordered the camo color pattern in Large and it fits the same around the waist but the length is definitely shorter than the other size Larges I have. Now that I own multiples of these I\'ll be able to detect right away when I receive a short one and make a return. However, if you\'re buying your first pair and receive one that seems shorter, it may be hard to tell.As I said before I\'m 5\'10" and 150LBS and the Large fits perfect and the length of the legs goes down below my ankle so that the pant legs rest on my shoes and my socks are hidden. When I perform a squat there is enough stretch and length to the pants that they don\'t ride up above my ankles either. That is, except on the camo model that has a shorter leg length. And until I order another camo model I don\'t know if this is due to the color pattern or just a random shorter length pair.These are my favorite pants, I continue to order them. I\'ve tried other variations from this company but these are my favorite.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 29, 2022', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars small is a bit baggy... wish x-small was still available', 'author': 'M', 'rating': 3, 'content': "initial quality seems very good. not sure how well it'll hold up after a few washes, but I can't find any flaws or QC issues out of the package which is great. i like the style and the fit, but small is a bit baggy. I was able to get an x-small a year ago-ish, but x-small doesn't ever seem to be in stock or the company stopped making them which is bad.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 8, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great Product..', 'author': 'Armando', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Perfect joggers. I‚Äôm 6‚Äô and 195 pounds with a 34-36 waist. Large is a great fit. Material is comfortable and surprisingly keeps me warm. Wasn‚Äôt sure because they are thinner than typical cotton sweats. Bought 2 and planning on 2 more colors now that I‚Äôve tried these with great results.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 5, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great fit', 'author': 'Amazon Customer', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Wasn‚Äôt sure my grandson would like the style and he did.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 15, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Perfect', 'author': 'Robert R. Pecoraro', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Form fitting sweats that look a little sexy I think. I do not workout in these. For me they are pants I wear with my regular clothes. I have received compliments when I wear these. Maybe I look good. Either that they noticeably look better then the other stuff I wear. Probably a little of both. üòÇ', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 9, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars way more that I expected', 'author': 'victor mendoza', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Nice quality, nice fit, I really like this product', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 5, 2024', 'is_verified': True}]

title: Men's Flex Tactical Pant Lightweight Stretch Work Cargo Pants EDC Casual Trouser Outdoor Sport Hiking Pant
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great looking, high quality pants. Husband Approved!', 'author': 'A to Z', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I ordered these for my husband and he absolutely loves them. He is actually wearing them as I write this!Originally I had in mind that he would utilize these hunting or fishing, but he wears them shopping, shoveling snow and even lounging around the house.He reports that these are very comfortable and especially likes the stretchiness. These fit him very well, and look good on him too. (And he knows it! He joked about all the women checking him out when he picked up milk at the store... sigh!)There are many pockets to store supplies like shells for hunting or tackle for fishing. He says these work pretty well in the cold despite not being insulated, and hold off the wind better than expected.My husband is picky and usually strictly wears jeans, so for him to be so impressed and actually prefer to wear these says a lot!Very well made, great fit and I find do them attractive on him (along with the hordes of women at the grocery store he had to fight off!)For reference I ordered a 34W x 32L. My husband is about 5\'10"ft and 180lbs.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 6, 2024', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Outstanding Versatility & Comfort', 'author': '‚òº', 'rating': 5, 'content': "They're an extremely comfortable pair of pants with a flexible ripstop fabric blend that is tough and both looks and feels amazing, with a great finish that leaves no loose threads or imperfections.The pants themselves feature an elastic waistband and a high-quality zipper that doesn't get stuck or bite on fabric.There are many large Velcro pockets in these pants, as well as a handful of useful smaller pockets.Additionally, lugging tools or keys around is made easy thanks to the two metal loops situated at the front of the pants.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 28, 2024', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Decent, but not perfect', 'author': 'ADM_NW', 'rating': 4, 'content': "These pants are okay. Like the description says, they are definitely lightweight. So don't expect them to stand up to super rough conditions. But should be a good option in warmer climates where you don't need much insulation or abrasion resistance. They do look good and fit well. Nice assortment of pockets to hold most anything. One thing I wasn't impressed with and can sometimes be an indication of the quality was the button hole. It isn't done well at all and the button kept catching on loose threads that were not properly sewn into the material. But overall they seem decent.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 17, 2024', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great tac pants - cut, color and sewing all high quality', 'author': 'White Spruce Tech', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'These IDOGEAR tactical pants are just what you need for your summertime outdoor adventure. These are nicely constructed to protect you being active outside. The sewing is nice and fabric rip-stop and slightly stretchy. There are extra seams to allow your knees to flex and nice elastic in the waist to keep them fitting well under your belt. Generous pockets and "hard points" to connect gear on carabiners or things like knives with belt clips. The color is great too. I chose the dark green and it will work fine for Scout pants.Just the garment you need as essential camping gear.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 31, 2023', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars Too short', 'author': 'treble101', 'rating': 3, 'content': 'Too short, "high water pants". 34Wx32L not good fit for 6\'2" person. They have great pockets and are well made", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 14, 2024', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Looks good', 'author': 'Scott Alli P', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'Took a while to get here but they fit good. Great pants and possibly acceptable for school uniforms', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 25, 2023', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Durable and Roomy pockets', 'author': 'Gary H', 'rating': 4, 'content': "These pants and durable and move well. Pockets are good and deep. My iphone, with its waterproof case, fits just fine in the cargo pockets, which I find many cargo pants with pockets too small. As a rock climber, I seek durable stretch pants. These do stretch, but it's not much and it's horizontally, I find vertical stretch better for outdoor activities, especially rock climbing, so I am a bit disappointed by that, so I removed a star from the rating. But for the price, these are a good durable pair of pants.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 16, 2023', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Ample Pockets', 'author': 'Glenn R. So avoid washing with whites.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 24, 2023', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great for Hiking, But Mind the Sizing', 'author': 'Klaus Treumann', 'rating': 5, 'content': "Recently got these Flex Tactical Pants for my husband. They're lightweight, stretchy - perfect for outdoor activities.But here's the twist - my husband has put on a bit of weight. So the pants didn't fit him. Disappointing, yes, but not the pants' fault. They seem true to size; just didn't account for the extra pounds.Now, the silver lining - they almost fit me perfectly! The cargo pockets are super practical, and the stretchy fabric is a plus on the trails.So if you're eyeing these pants, double-check the sizing, especially if there's been any recent size changes in your household!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 13, 2023', 'is_verified': False}]

title: Men's Athletic Running Sport Jogger Pants with Zipper Pockets
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Perfect Training Pant', 'author': 'BiggaBigK', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This is finally the training pant I\'ve been looking for! I\'m 6\'1" 175 lbs., slender build, and the Medium fits perfectly. Frequent problem for me is that Medium pants fit well in the waist but are too short, and Large pants have the right length but are too big in the waist. These ones are perfect in the waist AND length. They are SUPER stretchy and allow full range of movement, and the bottom of the legs don\'t slide up when you squat due to the stretch in the material. They are a medium-warmth; not super breathable/flimsy and also not super warm/fleecy. The drawstring is on the outside of the pant which is preferred to the bulk of inner drawstrings, and the drawstring seems to have more sturdy caps to the end of the string than the normal cheap flimsy caps. The feel of both the waistband and the leg bands at the ankle is perfect: snug, but not restricting. You have to want a more snug, tapered look and feel or these will not be for you. But if that is what you are looking for, these are better than any of the name-brand pants I\'ve tried in the past (UnderArmor, Puma, Nike...). Perfect for running, yoga, or pretty much any exercise you can do in the gym. Ordering a second pair!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 5, 2020', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars I love these pants but they all tear at the same french toasting spot.', 'author': 'Ikana', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I love these pants. I bought one pair, and loved them. They looked good, fit just wright, had zipper pockets so I don't lose my stuff. I bought several more pair, and I wear them almost exclusively. I cannot say enough good things.There's a design flaw though. The tear easily right above the zipper pocket. I followed all wash instructions to the letter. I hang them to dry. All of the pants on both sides get a small tear in exactly the same spot. I am not trying to force a muffin top into them. They're an easy fit. I DID, however, notice that a tear on one pair happened when I pulled up my pants by the waistband. Now, I pull them up from a lower spot.I would buy 10 more pairs if they didn't tear. PLEASE address this one thing!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States April 26, 2021', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Line Dry', 'author': 'David C', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'These pants are super comfortable. They fit very nicely. I\'m 6\'1" and weigh about 240. Normally wear a 32" inseam. These are probably not quite that long, but great for activewear. To my great surprise the label says line dry. I\'m really not used to that with my activewear, or any other clothing I buy. That said, when laundered as recommended, and line dried, they came out like new. Well, not quite. There are decorative finishes on the end of the drawstrings and one of them came off in the wash. I put a little epoxy on the end of the drawstring and stuck it back on, that should solve that problem. After I wear them a few times I\'ll probably end up tossing them into the dryer on low and hope for the best.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 4, 2019', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Not for the faint of heart', 'author': 'Jenna R.', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'These pants are high-risk, high reward. While other reviewers seemed turned-off by the "LIE KING" emblazoned down the side of the leg, I found that it adds an element of whimsy as onlookers are immediately alerted to the potential mischief that they may encounter. I like the color and patterned look, and my wife described them as "shiny" and similar to the appearance of leggings that are so often worn by today\'s Influencers. Another detractor that was noted by other reviewers was the zipper-pull, which has the word "Fashion" spelled out upon it. While I understand the criticism, I happen to appreciate this defining term, which once again alerts passers-by to my commitment to the world of modern, cutting-edge visual culture. In addition, I found the openings of the pockets to be rather small. A detractor? Think again. One can only imagine the flushed glances that are cast in my direction as I attempt to squeeze my hands into these undersized openings, eliciting thoughts of the adage "big hands, big......" 10/10.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States April 6, 2020', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars Liked them! Comfortable and fit until they ripped', 'author': 'raymond a. pacheco', 'rating': 3, 'content': "I really liked these in terms of comfort, fit snd style. I've only had them for a couple of months. I wasn't pulling very hard, I was surprised they the material ripped there. And unfortunate because it wasn't on a seam so it will be difficult or unsightly to repair", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 17, 2022', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great pants, bought more', 'author': 'CK', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I really like these pants. The new pants arrived quickly and no sooner than I removed the tag and put on the pants for a run, one of the pocket zipper would not open. The manufacture and quality control in the sourcing of parts and testing at the factory failed or was not performed.Unlike the first zipper issue which broke, a STUCK zipper SHOULD have been discovered before leaving the factory and reaching the reseller(s).Now looking for some new running pants which source from a LOCAL vendor as all this waiting and returning isn\'t worth it.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 3, 2019', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great quality with nice zippers. To start, the materials are like a cheap burlap. Scratchy, and will obviously fall apart quickly. Then, there is the poor craftsmanship. For the price, I wasn\'t expecting top of the line pants, but I did expect something that would fall apart on the first wearing. Finally, the add says "Cargo" pants, and "Three Pockets." I fancy myself as somewhat an expert at counting numbers under five, but I only come up with two for the number of pockets (just the two in front). Where there should be back pockets, they seem to have removed them and sewed the opening shut. I say that because there seems to be the extra layers of fabric for the pockets, and what looks like an extremely rough cut where the pockets were removed. For the two pockets that are there, they made these out of the really cheap silk-like material that will obviously fall apart. One additional note for the care instructions, which state "Hand Wash" and "Dry Clean Only." So, Cargo sweat pants that require dry cleaning? title: Men's Cotton Casual Shorts 3/4 Jogger Capri Pants Breathable Below Knee Short Pants with Three Pockets
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars great shorts', 'author': 'wyllis chu', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'stats: 5\'4" 165 lbs, waist 30" thigh circumference 24 1/2"i ordered the non mesh version of the shorts and the waist size is accurate. it does hug the thighs and butt but it\'s not uncomfortable or inappropriate. i was a little nervous doing heavy squats b/c it\'s form fitting but it held up fine. we\'ll see how good it holds up after multiple washes. if you don\'t want it hugging your legs or have bigger legs, order a size up. i\'ve ordered mesh versions of similarly made shorts and found that eventually the mesh does start irritating / poking my legs but the non mesh are great! the bottom cuff ends right at the end of my knee at the top of my calf. the waist draw strings are almost comically long but if you need it at least you got a good length of draw string. overall i\'d DEFINITELY order the non mesh shorts again, which i\'ll probably do next yr b/c i have them in heavy rotation and similarly made shorts all last almost exactly 1 yr before ripping or tearing at the seams.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 4, 2020', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Perfect(ish)', 'author': 'C.', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'If you‚Äôre worried about the fit at the waist, don‚Äôt be, the waist is very true to size. There was no slack or give at all as pictured. These fit perfect at the waist but was very form fitting everywhere else on me which gave me the look of yoga pants. However, the pants were not uncomfortable at all they still stretch and move with me and would be great for the gym or running but I couldn‚Äôt wear them out casually or running errands because of the yoga pants look they gave me (yoga pants are not everyday clothes people, accept it). I just ordered another pair a size up to give me the loose fit at the butt and thighs as pictured. This product still gets a perfect score for me as it is true to size and the tightness in the lower body is a ‚Äúme‚Äù problem and not the fault of the product. *the quality is AMAZING.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States September 13, 2019', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Alright', 'author': 'Reid Harris', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'Cheap fabric, but very good deal for the price. I wish I had a pair in every color.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 31, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars Lots of Good Qualities, One Major Consideration', 'author': 'Angel', 'rating': 3, 'content': "In the fairness of honesty, this is an updated review:It's very difficult for women to find a basic pair of black pants that aren't either jeans or dress pants. Even more difficult to find one that has pockets. You want to add on it being comfortable and non see-through? You're pretty much asking for a miracle. Not sure why women's clothing is rarely made with women actually in mind but that's why it's so difficult. That's also why I am providing you this detailed review to hopefully help you on your journey.Pros:- you can't see through it so nobody will be seeing your undies- light and breathable so you won't be sweating to death in it- has pockets (like real ones and not just for show)- elastic waistband- comfyCon:This is the part that is being updated. This is concerning the fit. The pants have a very loose and comfortable fit in general. They give lots of extra birth around the rear, the thighs, and the calves.They advertise these pants as being extremely elastic so they don't fall down. Well that's not untrue. But these are going to fit vastly differently between women who have washboard stomachs and those who don't. If you have a washboard stomach just buy your regular size and you will love these pants. If you do not have a washboard stomach and you wear these pants on any part of your body which causes them to not rest upon the bone of your hips, you will be uncomfortable.So why did I change this from two stars to 3 stars? Well other than the elastic band cutting off your breathing and making you throw up, the entire rest of the pants are actually extraordinarily excellent and people with washboard stomachs will be able to wear these comfortably. Also, if you still really want these pants since they are actually really great quality pants, you can order one to two sizes up (if you are between sizes then order two sizes up from the smaller of your sizes and if you are a solid size and measure one size up) or you can do like me and actually cut the elastic band out because it has a tie in it and then you just use the tie to keep them on and I have actually found that to be very comfortable. So I gave it an extra star because other than trying to squeeze you a size are too smaller than advertised, they are actually very nice pants.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States May 19, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Super comfy', 'author': 'Katie-did', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Super comfy! I almost want to wear them as PJs instead of pants. I absolutely LOVE the pockets though. It‚Äôs so much harder than most people think to find pants that aren‚Äôt khaki, denim, or women‚Äôs suit pants (not even always those) and still have pockets. Maybe people think we literally have a purse with us at all times and no need for pockets? I don‚Äôt know but women‚Äôs pants, and generally skirts and dresses too, definitely need pockets and these have them!The only real surprise I had with these pants between the pictures and description was that they had a lower rise waist than I expected, I would even go so far as to say they‚Äôre JUST higher than low rise when worn normally. I CAN hike them up a couple inches, tighten the drawstring just a bit more so they‚Äôll stay, but since they‚Äôre fitted till the legs widen that makes the pockets flare out like when the hips are WAY too big even though the waist fits. So I would disagree with the description of what the waist rise actually is for these even though you can easily buy a size up and wear the drawstring tighter.That and, although it‚Äôs not a big deal, the description implies that these are like the kind of pants that are almost dressy but definitely pants pants, not workout pants or something. However the material is fairly thick (although stretchy) and even though they aren‚Äôt fuzzy inside, they give the impression of sweatpants cut in a wide leg style to look more dressy. If you‚Äôre a confident person and can wear pretty much anything like it‚Äôs a ball gown if you want, you can definitely pull these off as pants pants. Otherwise people will likely wonder if they‚Äôre yoga pants, sweatpants, regular pants, and ask or try to feel the material.Either way you‚Äôll have a very comfortable pair of pants that breathe, are airy for summer (if you‚Äôre like me and hate shorts and/or can‚Äôt pull them off), and thick enough for winter if you use thermals or leggings underneath.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States August 15, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Love, love, love these amazing pants!!', 'author': 'Meditation Mommy', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'The media could not be loaded. I read the reviews and tried to follow suggestions by others. I ordered a 2X, because I normally wear a size 18 in pants. They were snug, so I would've needed a size or two up for a comfortable fit. Also, the fabric is like a thick, rigid cotton, so it doesn't give or stretch and it's not light and flowy. They didn't flatter at all.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 12, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Material is rough, not soft', 'author': 'Chris & Rita', 'rating': 4, 'content': "So many mixed reviews! Wow! But I'll just add my 2 cents. Mine are 2X so probably for smaller ladies the fit is perfect. They do fit well, but the elastic is too much, so they aren't flattering at all, but for the price I'm going to wear them around! The material is rough, course, and a bit stiff for clothing, not nice and soft :-( . Since they are bloomy around your legs you don't actually notice it, but sitting or just touching, you do. It may not be enough so you don't buy them, and if you're smaller, I think they do look like the model. My ankles aren't tiny, but these could be a bit tighter to help with the flattery part. The pockets are nice, but I don't really think you want to put anything an them.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 11, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Will shrink', 'author': 'sensitive', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'Bought in 3 colors. Fit perfectly after shrunk. !! I like vivid colors. Tho red background not as lite as shown. Would buy again!!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 1, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Great for cool summer pants.', 'author': 'Jan', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'I really the pants, the material is on the thin side but I think they will be very cool for the summer months. The front pockets are great and there size suggestions are perfect fit for me.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 9, 2024', 'is_verified': True}]

title: BROKIG Mens Zip Joggers Pants - Casual Gym Workout Track Pants Comfortable Slim Fit Tapered Sweatpants with Pockets
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Good looking and comfortable', 'author': 'Pugaloo', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I ordered this for my husband after he saw an ad for something similar that cost a lot more money on social media. These worked out great! Snug ankles that don‚Äôt bag, roomy and comfortable everywhere else, trendy and stylish to boot! He wears them to the gym and out and about. He liked them so much we just ordered another pair.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 27, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars My favorite thin jogger. Some colors look better than other.', 'author': 'Scott', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I recently purchased the BROKIG Mens Zip Joggers Pants and I have mostly positive feelings about them. While the fit is great and the material is comfortable, the color options are a little hit and miss.I found that for some reason, the grey colors look way better than the red, yellow, blue, and other options.On the positive side, the fit of these pants is great, especially if you have slightly thicker legs like I do. The waistband and cuffs have just the right amount of elasticity, ensuring a snug but comfortable fit. The zippers on the ankles are great for changing without needing to take off your shoes.Overall, I would recommend the BROKIG Mens Zip Joggers Pants to anyone looking for a comfortable and stylish pair of pants for workouts or casual wear. The grey color options are definitely the best, and the fit is spot-on for those with thicker legs. If you're looking for a reliable pair of pants that will keep you looking and feeling good, these are definitely worth checking out.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States April 24, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Great deal on these when purchased since gone up in price!', 'author': 'batchcorps', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'Overal for the money great no complaints.I am a big 6\'1" tall and 230lb man.They fit very snugly I purchased the largest size available and they fit snug.They give they feel comfortable and i like that the legs are very slim; no material flapping anywhere.Good value but tight fitting.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 17, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Not too skinny, not too baggy, they‚Äôre perfect!!!!!!', 'author': 'Manuel Torres', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I‚Äôm 5‚Äô7‚Äù tall, 190 lbs and I was looking for a jogger to wear to the gym. I didn‚Äôt want super skinny joggers but I also didn‚Äôt want them to be all baggy. These are EXACTLY what I was looking for. They are nice and slim but not skin-tight like some other brands. They‚Äôre ‚Äúslim-loose‚Äù. The material feels premium and they are super comfortable. I‚Äôll definitely order more pairs to wear them to the gym throughout the week.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 3, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars These fit my body perfectly, MOST of the time', 'author': 'zenraged', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I\'m 5\'10 150lbs and very athletically built. I\'ve been buying these in size Large because I feel like they do shrink a bit after a few washes. Also I suspect these pants are designed to fit tight, and I prefer a little extra room to move in.I currently have 5 pairs in Large and a few older pairs in Medium. Sometimes I\'ll receive a pair and the leg length will be shorter than usual. So the consistency of the product can fluctuate. This is rare though, usually they fit the same. I recently ordered the camo color pattern in Large and it fits the same around the waist but the length is definitely shorter than the other size Larges I have. Now that I own multiples of these I\'ll be able to detect right away when I receive a short one and make a return. However, if you\'re buying your first pair and receive one that seems shorter, it may be hard to tell.As I said before I\'m 5\'10" and 150LBS and the Large fits perfect and the length of the legs goes down below my ankle so that the pant legs rest on my shoes and my socks are hidden. When I perform a squat there is enough stretch and length to the pants that they don\'t ride up above my ankles either. That is, except on the camo model that has a shorter leg length. And until I order another camo model I don\'t know if this is due to the color pattern or just a random shorter length pair.These are my favorite pants, I continue to order them. I\'ve tried other variations from this company but these are my favorite.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 29, 2022', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars small is a bit baggy... wish x-small was still available', 'author': 'M', 'rating': 3, 'content': "initial quality seems very good. not sure how well it'll hold up after a few washes, but I can't find any flaws or QC issues out of the package which is great. i like the style and the fit, but small is a bit baggy. I was able to get an x-small a year ago-ish, but x-small doesn't ever seem to be in stock or the company stopped making them which is bad.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 8, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great Product..', 'author': 'Armando', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Perfect joggers. I‚Äôm 6‚Äô and 195 pounds with a 34-36 waist. Large is a great fit. Material is comfortable and surprisingly keeps me warm. Wasn‚Äôt sure because they are thinner than typical cotton sweats. Bought 2 and planning on 2 more colors now that I‚Äôve tried these with great results.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 5, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great fit', 'author': 'Amazon Customer', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Wasn‚Äôt sure my grandson would like the style and he did.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 15, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Perfect', 'author': 'Robert R. Pecoraro', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Form fitting sweats that look a little sexy I think. I do not workout in these. For me they are pants I wear with my regular clothes. I have received compliments when I wear these. Maybe I look good. Either that they noticeably look better then the other stuff I wear. Probably a little of both. üòÇ', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 9, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars way more that I expected', 'author': 'victor mendoza', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Nice quality, nice fit, I really like this product', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 5, 2024', 'is_verified': True}]

title: Women's Plus Size High Rise Tummy Control Bootcut Pant
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Marika is a quality brand and Amazon has great prices on them', 'author': 'langleyd', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I love the Marika brand of clothing. title: Men's Keb Trousers
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Really impressive quality and fit', 'author': 'Matt', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'REALLY happy with the Keb trousers - I\'m 6\'0, ~215 lbs, and the size 50 Regular fits great. Stylish cut that doesn\'t feel like "slim" but looks like it, stretches in the right places, lots of functional pockets and design choices, and seems very well designed and should last a long time. I also purchased some Revolution Race pants (Nordwand + GC Pro in size L) which are similar but fit a bit tighter - but most importantly - the ankle opening was tiny! I couldn\'t use them with hiking boots (and could barely get them over my ankles with socks on). The Keb\'s have a generous ankle opening (that can be buttoned down to fit snug with a lace hook).', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States June 24, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars An aboslute must in the woods.', 'author': 'Rick A. Matschke', 'rating': 5, 'content': "We've been on many hikes in fairly dense Vermont hills, with many miles challenging climbing loose sharp rock. These G1000 pants have never failed her at 5-2 or me at 6-2 in any way, tough, light, well fitted.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 28, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Worth Every Penny', 'author': 'Dave', 'rating': 5, 'content': "Wore these for about 30 miles of fairly technical hiking, bouldering, and mountaineering in the Colorado wilderness this past weekend. I was initially skeptical of spending over $200 on a pair of trekking pants but have to say after putting them through the paces this trip I am completely sold. Unbelievable quality and fit. Super convenient features. I had several instances of scraping my legs on rocks, branches, underbrush and fallen trees and came away unscathed. These are my favorite trekking pants ever and I will likely pickup another pair of Fjallraven pants for next summer's adventures too. Though these are more than able to handle several days of work on their own and I expect I'll use them for many many more years. Super high quality materials. Great product.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States September 25, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Awesome Pair of FjallRavens', 'author': 'Dr. SunGod', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Absolutely great slacks, great material, cut, build, fit, style, all great. One thing, the product pic in Amazon site is far from the reality. The reality fits the "Forest Green" description better. Whatever Laurel Green is, but the product description page has sorta limy green for the product pic, no can do. But great slacks, best ever from FalljRaven! I suppose pics change hue, etc, depending on medium of presentation, but not like this. They put the wrong pic. I was sold on the color in the product info page, but didn\'t get it. But, it\'s still a great pair of slacks. I want a pair for every day lol - but so true. They are insanely flattering (hugs in all the right places), ridiculously comfortable, very professional appearance. Gives working in the office less of a "chore" feeling.Now for the fit - I was unsure what size to get. I\'m 5\'2" and measurements are 35 B/30 W/41 H (oh yeah, my hips don\'t lie!). Based on the measurements the L would have been the obvious choice because of my hip size. I decided on the M/27" and it fit perfectly! It has a good amount of stretch and pull up just like regular yoga pants. Putting on/taking off gives zero struggle, super easy - even with my giant hips! They are a bit on the thinner side, so yes ladies if you\'re wearing anything other than a thong panty lines will absolutely show through (if that\'s a deal breaker for you). The length is absolutely PERFECT for me with flats.I got the one with 4 pockets (2 front/2 back). Front pockets are deep and very well constructed. For reference my Galaxy S23 Ultra completely fits in front pockets. Back pockets are on the smaller side, only covers 1/2 of my Galaxy phone, but personally I love the size of the back pockets, any bigger & the overall look might be off. Has functional belt loops as well, which is nice!Can\'t say enough positive things about these pants. They live up to the hype. title: Men's Bike Pants Long 4D Padded Cycling Tights Leggings Outdoor Riding Bicycle
reviews: [{'title': "5.0 out of 5 stars One of the few good, affordable men's cycling tights that you can wear in spring/summer", 'author': 'ChrisIIDX', 'rating': 5, 'content': "There aren't a lot of good choices for men's entry level cycling tights (as opposed to shorts) that work for spring/summer. I want tights so I can get some sun protection without having to deal with sunscreen. Thankfully, these seem to work rather well. The chamois is fine, it's not the best I've ever used, but it's adequate. The tights' fabric feels pretty good though. The tights don't slip down and they stay on just fine. The ankles have zippers and some silicone grippers to hold in place. There's a small zippered pocket just under the small of the back where you could store something small like a card or a bit of cash (maybe one key)Temperature wise, this seems to work for me from 50 F to about 95 F. You get some protection from wind chill but also sun protection. I haven't regretted riding in the summer with these tights, and they've been exactly what I've been looking for.Sizing seems about right if you're using Santic's US sizing. The US Medium fits me and I normally wear 32x32 jeans. I'd say that if you have underwear or sweatpants that use simple S/M/L/XL sizing, try that size first. It's probably going to fit. Be careful to base your sizing selection on what should be labeled as a US size.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States July 23, 2022', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars EXCELLENT CYCLING PANTS', 'author': 'German Arce Quesada', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Fit as expected, high quality materials, the quality of the pad add comfort during the ride.Until now, my favorite brand for cycling shorts.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States May 24, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars It‚Äôs a good deal', 'author': 'Marc T.', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'Comfortable and fits well', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States May 29, 2021', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Good quality.', 'author': 'BritTriker', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Excellent ankle zippers which zippers are a big problem on some garments cos cheaply made. These are great!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States July 1, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Fit perfectly', 'author': 'Amazon Customer', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Very comfortable', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 29, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars Not as advertised', 'author': "Critic's Choice", 'rating': 3, 'content': "The pants are just okay. Not nearly as nice as the Dinamik men's cycling tights they replaced. The Dinamik also has more padding. The pants I received did not have the pocket that was advertised.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 18, 2021', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars All around good winter pants.', 'author': 'B B', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'These pants are for the very cold. They do not have a pad so I would just wear them over my bibs and shed them when it gets warmer.I like these pants so much I wear them around the house on cold days. They have big pockets with zippers. They are not water proof but they are very thick.If it‚Äôs not very cold where you‚Äôre riding, I would recommend Santic a long bibs or long cycling pants.These are heavy duty cold pants and they keep my nice and warm on cold, cold days.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 25, 2020', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Buen material', 'author': 'john alcazar', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'Me quedo grande', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States July 22, 2021', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Buen ajuste', 'author': 'Heber Moran', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'C√≥modo y buen material', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States August 12, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '2.0 out of 5 stars Okay, but not great', 'author': 'Busy Mom', 'rating': 2, 'content': "Many reviews said the padding is in the wrong place, and I had thought that couldn't be accurate. Well, it turns out the padding really is 4 inches too far towards the front. I don't understand this, as I have bike shorts from the same company that fit great. I would buy more of their shorts, but these bike pants are just not done very well. To get the padding even close to the right area I have to jack them up ridiculously high in the back.If you're looking for warmth on a cold ride, they are not warm, only marginally warmer than just wearing bike shorts.The overall size fits as expected, just the location of the padding is very far off.All that said, the zipper pouch is cool, just small. And the legs have nice zippers on them to get your feet in and out.Not great. Wouldn't buy again. Would without question buy their shorts again though.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 22, 2021', 'is_verified': True}]

Luckily I found my wallet wedged next to the drivers seat in my car on the floor and that‚Äôs where it had slipped out. See photos for tear that occurred from poor sewing. This defect in workmanship happening in LESS THAN 2 MONTHS!!!I bought a large thinking it may shrink and fit better but it never shrunk after several washings and even with dryer settings set for high/cotton. So anyone with similar stats as me, 5‚Äô7‚Äù 160-170 lbs., medium is the size you‚Äôll want but that‚Äôs only If you won‚Äôt be using the pockets for anything of value or not at all, then in that case, these pants may be a consideration if price was your main object over quality!I will eventually get these sewn to use again and may have the other pocket reinforced with additional sewing. With that repair I know I could have just bought another pair, but besides the pockets sewing issue, the pants will still be usable at least and not a complete catastrophe!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States July 6, 2021', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars It was okay', 'author': 'Lennie', 'rating': 3, 'content': 'The pants are pretty stylish, but the material is pretty thin and ended up ripping after 2 days of wearing. One front pocket ripped the second time I wore it. Gusseted crotch is a bonus that makes them more comfortable.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 3, 2022', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great Fit', 'author': 'Rack', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I‚Äôm 6‚Äô2 , 34 waist, & 180 lbs. I purchased a size large & they fit great. I was pleasantly surprised that the length was long enough. I‚Äôm waiting for my next pair to be delivered.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 9, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Comfy!', 'author': 'Charme', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Great feel, soft and warm!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 27, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars Preliminary assessment on first two orders,,,', 'author': 'Bruce', 'rating': 3, 'content': '...after first wash and spin they both "survived" in terms of having no holes. I can sew somewhat so I can deal with some of those issues if they come up. The Black Streaky one came out the "cleanest" with very little lint. The Black Snow "exploded" with lint everywhere. Both were washed alone and separately which I would suggest to anyone, certainly at least for the first time. A sticky lint roller took care of both exterior and interior lint. Hopefully this will be the last time I have to seriously deal with that. I\'m 5\'9" at about 200 lbs. The large size on both will accommodate a waist up to 36" but it would get a bit tight after that. Both were consistent as to sizing. Length was too long for me and will have to visit the tailor to get hemmed. The material used is different depending on the color. The Black Snow is softer and more pajama-like while the Black Streaky appears to be cut from a somewhat stronger (my impression) material. I guess you could call this a slim cut if you compare it to other gym clothing but it\'s more than roomy enough for me to work out in. I would strongly suggest when you clean these to wash on delicate cycle inside out then spin dry inside-out. DO NOT tumble dry. That just asking for excessive pilling. Either just hang them to dry or use a non-tumble clothes dryer (I have one from Amazon). Would I buy these again? Yes, considering what the prices are in this market. I\'m just working out, going to the beach or shopping in them. As much as I would like to get a couple more of Addidas I\'m not spending 90 bucks plus. I like the cut, the looks and they are very comfortable. These are not "board room" clothing, but are medium-light fleece wear suitable for lower temps in the 40\'s high 30\'s F, for gym and basic day-to-day activities. I think however the Southpole joggers are a bit better in terms of quality than these.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States September 16, 2022', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great quality & stylish', 'author': 'Pdxcableguy', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Probably purchased about 10 of these joggers in varying colors for 3 teenage boys over the year. They\'ve torn through the knees a few times but after regular wear for months. Zippers great and really comfortable. Small for a 28-30" waist 140-165lbs; Medium for 30-31" waist 180lbs athletic teens. (5\'8" - 5\'10 goes to ankles) Highly recommend.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States June 13, 2021', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Amazing', 'author': 'Falcon', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I got these in all colors. title: Men's Keb Trousers Regular
reviews: [{'title': "5.0 out of 5 stars I'm shopping Fjallraven from now on.", 'author': 'Stephen', 'rating': 5, 'content': "THE FIT:I have done alot of research on Fjallraven and their products. I have purchased both the Keb Jacket as well as the trousers. I'm 5' 10 and 170lbs (normally wear a 31 waist with western jeans). I ordered the medium size jacket and it fits very well. I probably could have fit in small if I wanted a tighter sleeker fit but I wouldn't have any room for baselayers when the temps lower. (I wouldn't suggest getting a large Keb jacket unless you are at least 6' 180lbs.) The same can be said with the trousers. I ordered a size 48 and I have to wear a belt with them. A size 46 would probably have been a more perfect fit for my body type. Also the particular pair that came to me was a 48 LONG. These pants look great even if they are long because of the slim fit in the legs. I'm sticking with the 48 instead of trying to go to a normal 46 because I want to be able to put at least one baselayer underneath these pants. Ideally I would wear a tighter 46 for warmer temperatures and for an even more stylish fit. No one who looks at me would think my 48 doesn't fit. Thats how well tailored Fjallravens clothes are.THE MATERIAL:The Keb jacket and trousers are made of two main materials, a very stretchy polymide and a durable and rugged G-1000 material that Fjallraven has patented. When purchasing Fjallraven gear you must pay very close attention on which parts of their clothing are the greatly esteemed G-1000 material or some other material. This really makes a difference in durability and resistance to the elements. As for the Keb trousers, its one of their trousers that have the least amount of G-1000 material mainly due to versatility being the core of the design. But this doesn't mean the trousers are not durable because the G-1000 material is placed in all the areas that receive more wear. But the polymide on both the pants and jacket are more vulnerable to rough wearing, wind, and moisture than its G-1000 counterpart. After wearing this system in the wind and also the pouring down rain I would say that the polymide areas absorb water quickly. As for the wind, it blocks much more than a fleece but a little less than a softshell jacket would. With the exception of the hood being unusually water resistant, the G-1000 material absorbs rain water as well but it much more wind resistant than the polymide. I do no know how resistant the system is to snow. Although I was suprised at the water absorption I was experiencing it was probably a greater surprise at how fast this system dried out. These issues may seem bad but its qualities like these that make this system viable in hotter seasons as well.ENVIRONMENTAL APPLICATION:Considering the purpose of the Keb design, I am convinced that it performs the best in trekking in dry, open, non-heavy brush environments ranging from 89F - 24F with a thin wool or polyester baselayer for the colder temps. The Keb setup absorbs rainwater fast despite it being advertised as water resistant, however because of its primary synthetic make-up it drys very fast as well.CONCLUSION:I love the quality of Fjallraven's gear so much that I'm buying many more of their pieces. They make different pieces for different uses and enviroments but if you're looking for one general bugout outerlayer the Keb system is one of the most stylish, adaptable, durable, and well-rounded clothing systems on the market today.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States July 19, 2014', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great for bushcraft and camping!', 'author': 'Clark A. Junior', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'These trousers are awesome. Package arrived on time. Very durable and resilient pants, I wore them while trekking around the Appalachian Mountains, the G1000 material held up while kneeling and climbing over jagged rocks and briars. Very comfortable and the elasticity of the material in the groin area gives a lot of flexibility while climbing and traversing around rough terrain. While trekking in the rain and mud the trousers got pretty dirty. Washing was easy, to prolong the life of the trousers I washed them with good detergent and no fabric softener in luke warm water then air dried. A purchase you won‚Äôt regret.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States April 18, 2019', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars My New Favorite Pair of Pants', 'author': 'Brian H', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I was very hesitant on purchasing these pants as the price tag is a bit hard to swallow. However, I own the Granit wool button up shirt made by Fjallraven and know thay produce quality clothing. I first tried their Vidda Pro trousers and found that they were extremely tight in the thighs which constricted my freedom of movement so they were quickly returned. These Keb trousers were a night and day difference! The material allows for such a more relaxed and comfortable fit and does not feel constricting in any way! I absolutely love these pants and am very happy with this purchase! The quality and construction is second to none. For size reference I wear a size 34 waist and 32 length. If you found the Vidda Pro trousers constricting like I did, definitely give these ones a try.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 1, 2019', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Awesome pants! Great for all seasons.', 'author': "Client d'Amazon", 'rating': 4, 'content': 'This is my second pair of Fj√§llr√§ven trousers and I have to admit that they do not disappoint. They are very sturdy, and weatherproof. I survived the 2019 polar vortex with this trousers. It is also breathable, which should be great for the warmer weathers. My only problem was, the color shown in the photo did not match the actual item sent to me. It was a black-on-black, rather than a gray-on-black. Otherwise, I highly recommend this trousers!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 14, 2019', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Better than expected.', 'author': 'Mike Kilo', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Great pair of rugged outdoor pants, already field tested. I love the combination of cool, stretchy nylon and heavier cotton/poly twill "patches" (covering the knees and "seat") that are similar to the material used to make military issue combat fatigues. I wear size 35 or 36 pants; the size 52 fit nicely. Not too tight, not too loose.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States April 26, 2018', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': "5.0 out of 5 stars The only pair of hiking pants I'll ever need.", 'author': 'Justin from AZ', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'The media could not be loaded. These pants fit great, very comfortable and durable. After wearing them for a couple weeks on hikes and at work I decided to order the recommended wax (Greenland wax) to help protect my Fjall Raven Trousers. I watched YouTube videos on the application along with reviews.. some complained about the amount of wax provided but I was able to cover all the G-1000 material using 2/3 of the small block of wax. I found a heat gun on low work\'s very well with melting the wax into the material (sweeping across the surface at about 2-3" above). I look forward to putting these trousers to the test in the Arizona country.. I\'ll update my review over time.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States September 4, 2019', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars These pants are much better than I ever expected and the fit is perfect', 'author': 'Judah', 'rating': 5, 'content': "Worth the money! These pants are much better than I ever expected and the fit is perfect. I wear 28 waist and I'm 5'9. 44 fits like a glove. They are durable, yet very light and breathable.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States May 23, 2016', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': "4.0 out of 5 stars Awesome pants, get raw length if you're taller than 6'", 'author': 'PG', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'These are nice pants, typical Fjallraven high quality.They do, however, run short.If you\'re taller than 6\' you may want to search for the "raw length" version as these may be too short for you.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 31, 2017', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars He really does wear them pretty much every day', 'author': 'Rachel M', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'My husband won\'t even take these pants off. He tried to wear them to bed, and to church, and to a baptism. He really does wear them pretty much every day . He says they are the most comfortable outdoor pants ever. He finds them useful for hiking, hunting, basically anything outdoors. They are breathable, stretchy where they need to be, sturdy. He says, quote, "Finally it is like having yoga pants, except for manly men and they are much tougher." These pants get 5 stars!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 4, 2015', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Awsome pants/trousers', 'author': 'Kay Clanton', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Love these pants. I backpack and hike all the time. They are rugged yet light. I love the boot clip in the front and adjustable cuff. The zippers on the side help with air flow when you get a little warm. My go to pant in cooler weather.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 13, 2019', 'is_verified': True}]

reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars good fit, comfortable', 'author': 'Greg', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'this is my 4th purchase of this style shorts, all in different colors. some I bought several years ago so they are holding up well for me anyway. they do run a little small in size, I have a 30" waiste and ordered Medium and it is a snug fit (I usually get Small). They add a pop of color to any outfit, and are trendy.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 4, 2023', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars A nice pair of sweatpants, but they‚Äôre not baggy.', 'author': 'KsCuzin', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'I ordered the Caracilia baggy high-waisted sweatpants in a size small after viewing the provided size chart. I always take a chance on bottoms, because my waist measurement is usually at least a couple of inches larger than what‚Äôs recommended on size charts. That was the case with these sweatpants, but because the hip measurement was more than accommodating and the waistband was fully elasticized, I took a chance that a small would work. The pink color is accurately represented in the photos. Thankfully, the small does fit, but the description states the sweatpants are ‚Äúcasual baggy‚Äù, and I don‚Äôt feel they‚Äôre baggy anywhere. I like the stitched seams down the front of the legs, and think it makes the sweats a little more dressy than a standard pair of sweatpants. The pockets are nice and deep and will easily accommodate my iPhone 12 Pro, as well as other small necessities. The waistband doesn‚Äôt have a drawstring, but is elasticized all around, and isn‚Äôt overly tight. There‚Äôs also elastic at the hem, which again fits comfortably. I‚Äôm truly appreciative of the length of these‚Ä¶they‚Äôre actually long enough to reach my ankles. The knit fabric is stretchy and soft to touch on the outside. The inside has more of a terry look and feel to it. The quality of the Caracilia high-waisted sweatpants is very good. There are no notable construction issues, and the seams are all finished cleanly inside. The topstitching through the pants is neat and even with no missed stitches. Prior to wearing these the first time, I washed them per instructions and then hung them to air dry (I air dry almost all of my clothes). They laundered without problems‚Ä¶no shrinking, fading or pilling. Overall, I am very pleased with these and would recommend them, with the understanding that they aren‚Äôt a true baggy fit. Relaxed maybe, but not baggy.For reference, my measurements are:Height - 5‚Äô4‚ÄùBust - 35‚ÄùWaist - 30‚ÄùArm length - 22.5‚ÄùShoulder width - 15‚ÄùWeight - 120#Inseam - 31‚Äù', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States September 27, 2023', 'is_verified': False}]

title: Men's Workout Sport Pants, Athletic Running Jogger Track Pants Casual Sweatpants Trousers with Pockets
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Very comfortable', 'author': 'Brian', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I wasn't sure what to expect. I've had these for a couple months now and use them for gym wear. The material feels like great quality, fairly thick material, that is very comfortable to wear. I think they look good as well. They were true to size.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 19, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Truly awesome pants. Just too small for me.', 'author': 'MrPatrick', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I am so disappointed! These pants are awesome. Great quality. Great style. Perfect amount of stretch. But they‚Äôre too small, and they don‚Äôt offer a 2XL size option!!! Dogonnit!If the manufacturer or seller reads this, PLEASE GET ME 2XL IF YOU CAN! I will buy a bunch of colors.To help others figure out sizing... I am 5‚Äô 11‚Äù, 220 lbs. I am NOT fat, just have a lot more muscle than the average, along with a strong set of glutes. The waist still has plenty of room, but the buttocks area it too tight. The leg area is also pretty snug.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 9, 2020', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Upholstery BEWARE! I still love them', 'author': 'Ron Queue', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'Reasons for not giving full 5 star1. Quality could be better2. Zipper on back could ruin your car upholsteryI like these pants very much. They are very comfortable and look great. The reason I gave it a 4 star was because the quality could be a little better. When I squat or bend over Some of the seams might rip. I actually noticed some areas with threads that are hanging loose or frayed. The right pocket already has a hole in it, so my keys fall through to my ankle. However, I don‚Äôt usually use pockets at the gym so I can live with it. Another downside is that the zipper on the back is great so you don‚Äôt lose stuff, but it‚Äôs big enough that every time i slide into my car leather seats it almost rips into it.Regardless, I still like these pants because I understand I‚Äôll probably be buying replacements since I‚Äôm pretty active. For the price, I can‚Äôt really complain. I love that they actually have zippers, since many active pants you can easily lose something from your pockets without noticing. Just make sure a hole didn‚Äôt appear like mine did in my right front pocket. I‚Äôll probably buy another pair.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States May 15, 2021', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars Quality has gotten shaky', 'author': 'Thomas Kamakani', 'rating': 3, 'content': 'I order a pair of these about a year and a half ago. Absolutely love them, wore them on stop.Just ordered two more pairs, one the same color and one a new color‚Ä¶ they are different.While they generally look the same, they two new pairs are made out of thinner, less durable fabric and are much slimmer that the old pair. The stitching is also slightly different, but that‚Äôs not too big of a deal.Super frustrating. Was looking forward to rocking the new ones, but now they‚Äôre getting returned.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 17, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '1.0 out of 5 stars Terrible', 'author': 'jason dipierro', 'rating': 1, 'content': 'This product is terrible! I‚Äôll definitely buy more.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 30, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '2.0 out of 5 stars Odd pocket placement', 'author': 'Matt Cash', 'rating': 2, 'content': "Overall, these are some very comfortable pants. Solid fabric. My only real complaints are that the zipper pockets are oddly positioned and why is the left pocket not a zipper pocket as well? They‚Äôre a little thin and the fabric takes a couple of washes to feel really comfortable, but after that they are really nice to wear to workout or chill in.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 31, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Simply just cool to wear', 'author': 'Max Barrios', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'These things are just fun and cool to wear. They are durable, and I have worn them to death because I love any chance I get to wear them to the gym. They are form fitting, and definitely make leg day feel worth it. Amazon, you\'re asking the wrong questions!]Fabric is a densely woven poly. The splatter print is exactly as pictured. Ankle cuffs fit well and the amount of roominess in the legs is appropriate for the amount of stretch in the fabric... though at times they feel just a wee bit too big. So, what am I really complaining about? The waistband SUCKS! Why? It\'s a 2" band of elastic that\'s encased in the garment fabric along with the pretty-standard, flat, trainer-shoe lace. The problem? The elastic is not adequately anchored inside the waistband of the pants. Whereas most companies will stitch the elastic along the entire waistband, UNIFACO does not. Additionally, the drawstring somehow winds around the elastic, which flips and flops different directions every time you adjust your pants. But the question you should be asking: WHY MUST I KEEP ADJUSTING MY PANTS? Since the fabric is so smooth, and since the waistband is encased, and since there is nothing there to grip the skin on the inside of the waistband of the pants, I find myself tugging at my pants every few minutes while I\'m at work. (I\'m a bartender, and even on a slow night I don\'t have time for this nonsense!) HOW CAN THE MANUFACTURER FIX THIS PROBLEM? Silicone grips on the inside of the waistband... coupled with a narrower elastic band and a more robust, barrel-weave drawcord.If you\'re in the sagger subculture, then these pants are likely for you.But if you seriously don\'t want to be compensating for the fact that your pants are constantly falling down, you might want to look elsewhere. @UNIFACO: Add some silicone grips to the circumference of the inside waistband! Golf pants--GOLF PANTS, FFS!--even have this. You need to step it up a notch.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States May 19, 2022', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars super colorful', 'author': 'woodson murphy', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Got these for my son for his bday. title: Men's Adaptive Sweatpants with Outside Seams
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Perfect', 'author': 'Jessica D Nieves', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Fits great.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 22, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great Sweats with Velcro at Ankles', 'author': 'Antigone Walsh', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I applaud this company for making fine quality clothes for the disabled. that being said the major ccomodation is a elcro strip t each of the ankles. This can accomodate a brace or help go over heavy boots.The fabric is loely; soft and cozy. These pants looks sharp, which is saying something for seats. Their is a rawhide cord for the drawstring waist. The rich navy vblue is accented by red and white accents around the pockets. There are two front slash pockets and a back pocket. The back pocket is usble but you hve to cut it opoen as it is sewn shut. There is a faux fly which may be deal breaker for some. Machine wash inside out in cold water on the gentle cycle and tumble dry on gentle wiht low heat. these are terrific sweats really for anyone.The quality is excellent howeer the accomodation is minimal.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 23, 2018', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Very Good Quality', 'author': 'd', 'rating': 4, 'content': "I commend, from the bottom of my heart, Tommy Hilfinger's efforts at adaptive clothing. Our families need this! Thank you. I did a search to find sweats with a zipper fly. These pants have velcro at the cuffs. They do not have a useable fly. I should have read more carefully. I kept them because they are high quality and I wanted my husband to try them out. They are very high quality and very soft and very good for fall and winter. They run large, order a smaller size than usual. There is a very active community of Stroke Survivors in the Cleveland area who need adaptive clothing. If Tommy H. is listening: you're on the right track: we need men's sweats/active pants with zipper/velcro flys. We need different sizes: XXXL, XXXXL and in longs. We also need a good selection of feminine one-handed women's clothing. We commend your efforts.
