title: Men's Vaha Pant 34" Inseam
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Best "house pants" I can imagine wearing', 'author': 'S. Kingsford', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'You are reading this to determine the following information about these pants:1. Size accuracy - I am a size 32-33\' waist, typically 30\' pant length and a MEDIUM fits me comfortably, perfectly fitted but light and comfortable.2. Durability - The way the groin is stitched includes this irregular diamond pattern that allows for a lot of flexibility without any tension on that typically high-tension area. The material itself is hard to descibe, it\'s lightweight and soft on your skin but feels very strong. I was able to machine wash then dry at low-heat; I let them air-dry to finish.3. What is a house-pant? To me these are pajamas because I don\'t want to get them dirty mowing the lawn and doing whatever else. I think they could serve as your go to every day pants. The pockets are deep, the appearance is not pajama-like, and they are extremely comfortable.5/5 best "house pants" imaginable.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States May 3, 2020', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great Casual House Pants', 'author': 'August West', 'rating': 5, 'content': "Over the summer I happened to try a pair of prAna Vaha shorts and liked them so much I immediately ordered a two more pair. They ended up pretty my much the only casual shorts I wore all summer giving the boot to my other shorts.I wear them everywhere.When it cooled down I wanted something a nicer than the sweat pants I always wear around the house. Since I loved my Vaha shorts so much I decided to see if they made a similar pant and was very happy to see they make Vaha pants also. Rather pricey but Amazon had a screaming good deal on the dark ginger color so I ordered a couple of pair. And just like the shorts I loved them immediately and are now really the only pants I wear around the house. The waist band is the best of any pants I've ever had while the fabric is stretchy enough to be super comfortable. Although the fabric isn't super plush, it is light weight and quick drying. So far my pants and shorts have held up well.That being said, they do look like pajama bottoms which is probably why they are so comfortable. So far I've only worn them around the house. You could wear them when going out and I may work up the nerve to do that but haven't so far.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 17, 2019', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Pants I can wear out and to the gym or just around the house.', 'author': 'MG', 'rating': 5, 'content': "So I liked these so much this is my 3rd pair. They did my body frame no justice.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 18, 2023', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Not Just For Women', 'author': 'Elijah J.', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This \'00 throwback parachute pants are fantastic! Though learning that we all wore back in the \'00s is now considered vintage clothing style really made me feel my age. :D never the less these are great! The are very loose fitting, as expected for this style, but fit well. There is bungie cord with clasps on the waist and ankles for tightening and adjustment. They definitely are made from that parachute style fabric that goes "swoosh swoosh" when you\'re walking. I\'m 5\'10" 170lbs and they fit me quite well in an XL. As to why these are being specifically marketed to women I do not know. Nothing about these screams "feminine." They are just parachute pants so they are genderless. These are great for relaxing in and I\'m sure will be fantastic for the club scene and raver crowd as well .So if you want some comfy pants that throw back to the \'00 go for it. My only complaint is the price. I think they should be closer to $19.99 but they really aren\'t much more expensive than that so it\'s a minor complaint. I can definitely recommend these pants for your purchase consideration.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States September 2, 2023', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Love the style', 'author': 'JHrunning', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Love the parachute styled pants. The length is slightly longer for me, but I am pretty short so sometimes I do step on them at the back of my heels. I am 5‚Äô4‚Äù and 115 lbs as reference. Size small fits me perfectly. They go very well with a smaller shirt. The color is neutral. I‚Äôm totally a fan!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States September 10, 2023', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '2.0 out of 5 stars Size is way off', 'author': 'Sl063122', 'rating': 2, 'content': "Very cute pants but don't go by the refereed size because they run very large.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 4, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars Looks cheap', 'author': 'Milk', 'rating': 3, 'content': 'In the pictures the pants look really nice, but in person they look more cheap from the material and fit a little weirdly.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States September 22, 2023', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Comfortable and well fitting', 'author': 'James Murphy', 'rating': 5, 'content': "My wife said she wanted some circa-1990s parachute pants. reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars So comfortable!', 'author': 'SCshopper', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'These pants were comfortable and fit perfectly. Will order more soon.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 11, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars On the fence with this pair of pants', 'author': 'M.B.', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'I was looking for some inexpensive lightweight joggers to wear hiking or while cleaning the house or yard as I\'ve always been afraid to wear my ridiculously expensive Athleta joggers doing either. I received this pair yesterday and here are my thoughts:Pro:1. Color options are virtuously infinite and price point is excellent. I ordered the khaki, but was going to consider other colors if the fit was right.2. Fabric is lightweight, but opaque, doesn\'t show panty lines, very stretchy, nice drape and soft to the touch, just like the Athleta joggers.3. Lots of pockets: slant (not bulky) pockets in the front, one zippered pocket over the lumbar spine (for keys or a very tiny pet maybe? too shallow for a phone).4. Length works for me. I am 5\'2", the bottom sags some which is totally fine with me, even gives it a bit of a cool vibe. This pant should easily work for average height women, lengthwise.(Only one) Con:1. The waist is a tad tight. I ordered a medium which is what Amazon recommended and, while the fabric is overall very stretchy, the very top of the pants where it falls on the waist has a double seam on the inside which gives that area much less give. Picture of waist unstretched is attached. I don\'t think I\'d exchange it for a large, that would probably be too big.In all, I\'ve decided to keep these and see if the waist thing becomes a non-issue later.For reference, my natural waist is 30 inches and I wear a size 6 in Athleta joggers.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States May 21, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars One of my best purchases by far', 'author': 'Kathleen Barron', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'These pants look amazing. The fabric is great. The fit is perfect and they‚Äôre very versatile. I am definitely buying more.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 2, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Comfortable', 'author': 'Jean Finnegan', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'These are the most comfortable joggers, lightweight, with pockets and high waisted. Absolutely love these as I have them in many colors‚úÖ‚úÖ‚úÖ‚úÖ‚úÖ', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 27, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars Runs Small', 'author': 'Redhds', 'rating': 3, 'content': "Purchased these for yoga class and around the house. Normally I wear an L-XL in leggings. These ran small, especially around the hips. Decided to return, as they won't give me the stretch and comfort I need for movement. Overall quality seemed fine however. Hope they fit you better than mine!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 8, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great for running!', 'author': 'Daniel Cappelli', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'After spending years trying to find a compression pant I liked for running I gave these joggers a try. I want to get another pair.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 20, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Love these but.....', 'author': 'Ta Kruger', 'rating': 4, 'content': "I wasn't sure about these when I saw them in the package but when I tried them on, I fell in love! title: Mens Golf Pants Slim Fit Lightweight Casual Dress Work Stretch Pants Trousers Two Back Zip Pockets
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Finally', 'author': 'Brad Dorschel', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I rarely, if ever, review anything. However, after searching forever for light weight, stretch golf pants I can wear straight from the office to the course I felt it had to be done. These are great! Everything you need without costing a fortune. I have an athletic build and thick legs, I did size up from my regular 34x30 to a 36x30 and the fit is spot on. Ordering the other colors now.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 7, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Light and comfortable', 'author': 'Ross', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'These are very thin, light fabric -- ideal for a hot summer day if you want to look like you\'re wearing "real pants", but want to not be too hot. The fabric also has a little bit of a sheen to it that doesn\'t come through in the pictures.Men\'s pants are usually sold with 2-number sizing, waste and inseam measurements; these only have one series of sizes. I usually wear 38x30 pants, and found that their size 38 felt comfortably, almost loosely, around my waist, but the legs looked more like a 38x32. Maybe what they mean by "slim fit" in the title is "legs are long in proportion to the waist." If so, that\'s a bit unfortunate, since it\'s the opposite to how the typical middle-aged American male is shaped. In fact Amazon, based on my purchase history, recommended I probably wanted a 40! A good thing I didn\'t believe them.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 27, 2023', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Nice pants', 'author': 'Kola Oyedele', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I like the fit of the pants.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 26, 2023', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Classy', 'author': 'Anthony Tuccillo', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'These golf pants are great, fit well and look good. They can be dressed up or down and can be used for many occasions other than golfing. The waist and length are spot on and are made of a very lightweight yet strong material. I rec then to anyone looking for a good pair of golf/dress pants!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 8, 2023', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars VERY SMALL & TIGHT WAIST LINE - NOT TRUE TO SIZE', 'author': 'Korey', 'rating': 3, 'content': 'I do really like the material and style of these golf pants. They are made with a cooling and stretchy material that I find to be very comfortable and relaxing to wear. However, I ordered the size 36, which is what I have in other pants, and these were too small and tight on the waist. The length of the pant leg is fine and is as it should be, but for me and my experience, the waist line needs some improvement.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 9, 2024', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Super soft and silky', 'author': "Jimme'", 'rating': 5, 'content': "I wasn't expecting these to be so silky feeling. They are very well constructed and have plenty of pockets. They fit perfectly fine and are really nice pants. They have a nice stretch to them, so they are perfect for everyday use as well. I really like the fit. They are true to size. These are also very light material, may be too cold to wear during the winter months.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 24, 2023', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Great quality but size up 1 for best fit!', 'author': 'Sammy | Olivia Nyx', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'I read reviews before purchasing these that said since they are a slim fit, sizing up would be recommended. I am here to say the same thing.My husband is 6\' 2". He typically wears between 36-38 x 32" pants. He also has what I call "footballer" thighs. It is hard to find pants for him because his thighs are more muscular.Given the recommendations from other reviews and knowing his legs, I ordered the 40" pants. They are a slim fit but these fit his legs perfectly. The waist does have a little room in it, but that is assuming because he floats between a 36 and 38. The quality of the pants are a nice "golf pant" quality, and they look very professional that they are a great stretch fit professional pant for work as well. He loves them.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 26, 2023', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Good for golfing', 'author': 'Keith Price', 'rating': 5, 'content': "These are comfortable with good stretch. They're easy to move around in such as when gulping. The material is soft, lightweight and breathable, which I like a lot. I also find them to be reasonably attractive.They seem to have a good compromise between being lightweight and durable. I don't get the impression that these are going to split at the seams or develop holes anytime soon.My only complaint would be how easily it wriggles and retain those wrinkles.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 23, 2023', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Very nice, run a little small/tight', 'author': 'William', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'I really liked this pants but they‚Äôre definitely a little on the small side. I comfortably fit into a 34x34 with just about any brand. The size chart provided is effectively useless because it doesn‚Äôt really match the options to choose from. They are slim, which I am fine with but the waist is definitely a little smaller than advertised, and there was really no way to accurately know the length. While they were comfortable as could be and made very well, I really would recommend going a size up than whatever you normally wear. I can‚Äôt fault them being too short because I am exceptionally tall (6‚Äô4‚Äù) when it comes to pants. Most brands only make a 34Wx32L, which is what these are but even the 34W was more like a 33W. All that said, if you get a size up you should be fine. Just wish I had done that! I‚Äôd definitely be wearing these on the regular!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 1, 2023', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Definitely A Slim Fit', 'author': 'tjutter2', 'rating': 4, 'content': "I normally wear size 35W x 30L pants. I took a gamble on size 34, figuring the elastic in the waist might make up the difference. Instead, these pants were a little too snug - everywhere. Maybe I'm just not built for slim fit.Aside from the snug fit, these pants were a bit too long (see pic), and the fabric had a little more sheen than I'd like.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 19, 2023', 'is_verified': False}]

title: Men's Lightweight Hiking Pants with Belt 5 Zip Pockets Waterproof Quick-Dry Travel Fishing Work Outdoor Pants
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars They are lightweight, durable, and ideal for what I am looking for.', 'author': 'Ken Anderson', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I'm 72 years old, and while I hike in the woods perhaps more than many other 72-year-olds, I am not a long-range hiker, although I do think about it now and then. These would do very well for those who want to thru-hike the Appalachian Trail, as they are well-made, very light, durable, and water-resistant, if not actually waterproof. I still need to do that test. Whatever your age might be, if you are looking for something that looks reasonably good, has plenty of pockets, is very lightweight, and is durable, these are a good choice. I've worn my first pair several times and am pleased with them.That's not why I bought them, however. As mentioned, I am 72 years old and carry a bit more weight than I would like. Absent a diet and exercise plan, I am always looking for pants that will stay up, and there are some places where sweatpants just aren't appropriate. As you age and put on some weight, your body undergoes changes that render regular pants with a belt insufficient. You don't think old people wear suspenders as a fashion statement, do you? I grew up on a farm but only began wearing suspenders a few years ago. Fortunately, by the time you've reached your 70s, you've lost some of your vanity, so I wear suspenders occasionally, but I can't say that I like them.These will stay up under normal circumstances even without the belt that comes with them. With the belt, there are no worries whatsoever, so I can carry things with both hands without worrying about my pants falling, and there is no need for suspenders.I've purchased a couple of these. If they came in a few more colors, I'd buy more.Later... They are available in several colors now, so I've ordered a third pair.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 21, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great pants for hard work', 'author': 'Christina', 'rating': 5, 'content': "These pants are so light and comfortable and a bit water resistant too. I work at a stable so these have been great work pants for warmer days. They resist a bit of water, and also dry fast if they do get wet. I like the feel of the material and the multiple pockets as well. Next spring I'll be buying more of these.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 31, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Nice fit and decent material', 'author': 'Loanbandit', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'I can\'t speak to longevity but I like the slim fit and feel of the fabric. Plentiful pockets that zip except for the rear and a little stretch is nice, especially at the waist.The measured inseam on these is 31", not 29.3" as listed in the size chart. I have a 29" inseam and was looking forward to a proper length. It should get returned just based on the improper length but have decided to keep and alter due to the overall fit.Add a low-rise waist and it will become a fashion sensation!!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 20, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Very nice design and great fit. Lightweight and flexible.', 'author': 'That Chap', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I purchased one pair of these TBMPOY Men's Hiking Pants to do a shoot-out comparison with three other similar products from different makers, and these pants were the clear winner. I normally wear size 36x30 pants, and the size Large fit perfectly. I especially like the clasp closure and the sewn-in belt, which keep the pants up over my hips when I put my phone and wallet in the front pockets. The other pants I compared them with did not score well at that. They fit like regular trousers rather than sweatpants, and they look more classy than sweats. They are extremely lightweight and flexible, and will be perfect for wearing so long as the weather is not too cold. I would guess that below 60F these pants will not be sufficient to keep my legs warm unless I'm moving, but otherwise they're the perfect summer pant. I bought three more colors.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 25, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Exactly what I was hoping for', 'author': 'Amazon Customer', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I have been looking for lighter pants for work and outdoor activities. Denim jeans just don't seem to cut it for me anymore as they have zero protection from wet or cold. Now these aren't exactly designed for the cold but you could wear some thermals underneath pretty easy and you're good with a lot more water resistance. The fit was perfect on these and are comfortable going anywhere.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 26, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars Odd pocket flap direction and slip tab', 'author': 'Mr. Stark', 'rating': 3, 'content': 'Overall the cargo trouser fits very nicely. I ordered a size down for a more slim fit look as the waistband stretched to my normal size with plenty of more to go. The material is flexible and breathable. I am currently in Africa and it‚Äôs humid. I was very comfortable all day. Great for wearing on the plane ride too.The only two issues I have with the trouser are the flaps over the zipper for the front pockets. The flap is sewn on the opposite side with opening facing forward instead of normally backwards towards the rear. So getting in the pocket is comber some as my wrist has to turn inwards to unzip and enter. When I am seated , debris can collect as it becomes a cup to catch everything.The slip tab on the waist should be a button or snap button. The slip tab can be easily undone if enough force pushes it out of the hook.Overall it is a good buy if you can get it under $25. Otherwise there‚Äôs better options out there. I purchased this one because of the color.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 28, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Loving these so far', 'author': 'MC', 'rating': 5, 'content': "Wasn't sure about the material or thickness of these from photos, but after arrival the size fits well and I am very happy with the weight of the fabric and the fit. The material is on the lighter side which is exactly what I wanted as I run hot and other hiking pants retain too much heat for me to be comfortable. Only downside is the pant front lower pockets are really tailored for carrying a phone or anything bigger than band aids, some change or a pocket knife so they're not super useful. Overall I've been wearing these to kick around the house and throw on for quick short trips out of the house when I don't want to think about or wear jeans. They fold nice and tight for packing as well. Will definitely buy 1 more pair in another color.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 11, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars 6\'1" 145lbs - Got M - perfect fit.', 'author': 'Alex S', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I got 3 different types of travel pants to try out from different Amazon stores. These were my favorite. I'm tall and skinny. These had a better slim profile to the legs, and perfect length. Others were too baggy or too short. I wish they also made a zip off version! Only thing I don't like, is all travel pants only have a back right pocket. I'm just a lefty living in a righty world I guess. But yes overall 100% would buy again.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 11, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars 10/10', 'author': 'Chavelle', 'rating': 5, 'content': "Somewhat big since it's a men's size, but that's kind of what I was going for because I wanted to wear my Spanx underneath. A little extra space provides more room for movement as well. I got to try these out on a 10 mile unkempt ridgeline hike yesterday. The material is thin but very durable. Saved my legs from miles and miles of overgrown uluhe and other foliage. Really loved these pants and that they came with an easy latch belt. 10/10 would recommend especially at this price point!!!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 4, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Best Bleach Proof Pants Out', 'author': 'cameron', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'As a Powerwasher I am constantly getting holes in my pants from the chemicals getting splashed everywhere, but with these pants I haven\'t noticed any major ripping. The only suboptimal thing about these pants are the pockets. After a while they start to fray and soon rip off. This doesn\'t stop access to the pocket however it can make it unconformable to reach in and grab the items its holding. title: Women's Fleece Lined Pants Straight Leg Sweatpants Pull-on Dress Pants with Zipper Pockets Athletic for Golf Running
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Comfort, warmth, and versatility!', 'author': 'Amazon Customer', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Buy these, you won‚Äôt regret it. Wish I can give these pants 10/5 stars. They were perfect. I wore these on the plane and they kept me warm and they don‚Äôt wrinkle! I wore them over tights on the day it was snowing and they kept me warm all day. Snow rolled off as soon as it hits the pants so they never got wet and damp. I got the gray, but I am going to buy the black and navy and use them as my work pants as well. You can probably wear these year round for work if your office is kept at a freezing temperature like mine. But if you WFH, lucky you, they are so comfortable you‚Äôll also want to wear them to sleep.Pros:- stretchy waist band- do not wrinkle- two LARGE side pockets with zipper, but not bulky- perfect length- warmth- versatility: dress up, dress down, go hiking, pajamas, whatever you wantCons: none!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 22, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Warm for winter golf!!', 'author': 'C. Tucker', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I bought these for winter golf. I live in MD, and the weather can be a bit mercurial. I was skeptical at first, but was surprised they keep my lower half warmer than my jeans if I am on the golf course. I\'ve played when it was 31 degrees when we teed off, and I was comfortable the whole 18 holes.These pants have two zippered side pockets, but no back pocket (the only minus for me). The pants sit at the waist, and are very comfortable and move with you. The legs are loose at the ankle, there is no taper. The material is not overly heavy. I don\'t know if I would call these "fleece lined" because the fleece is not obvious. There is a difference in material texture from outer and inner, but I\'ve had fleece lined pants before and these don\'t fit that description. However, they do their job very well, just don\'t expect a thicker, typical fleece lining.Perfect for cold weather golf!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 3, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Size jump', 'author': 'Irma G.', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'I have had Baleaf insulated leggings for years. They are excellent quality and last forever.I got these because I wanted sweatpants that are comfortable for home, but nice enough for the grocery store.The deep zippered pockets are big enough to hold my phone and keys when I go for walks.I started with the XL size, which fit great in the length, legs and thighs, but was tight in the hips and waist. The jump to XXL seemed like more than just one size. The waist and hips are comfortable, but they‚Äôre baggy in the thighs and too long. I kept the larger size, because sweatpants should be comfortable. I wish they didn‚Äôt look so sloppy big.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 3, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great golf pants for cold weather', 'author': 'Amazon Customer', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I ordered these to wear golfing on cold and windy days and I was very pleased. Very comfortable and the lining keeps you warm even in high winds. The fit is wide in the hips and legs. I should have ordered a size smaller. If you like a slim fit this is not for you.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 9, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars Decent', 'author': 'Tiffany Thian', 'rating': 3, 'content': 'These sweatpants aren‚Äôt bad; they fit me well. They‚Äôre not exactly flattering, though. I wear these on cold days for golf, but not outside that. The inside is nice and feels soft, and the outside is just average. I like the zippered pockets and the waistband. Some other sweatpants‚Äô waistbands are uncomfortable because they cause small vertical indents in the skin, but it wasn‚Äôt the case here. It‚Äôs smooth and doesn‚Äôt leave marks, yet it hugs the waist nicely. These pants aren‚Äôt a good or bad buy; they‚Äôre just a decent product.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 16, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great product', 'author': 'patt dodd', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'These pants are great quality, comfortable, fit well. I have 3 pairs.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 24, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great buy!!', 'author': 'j. nord', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'These pants are so comfortable & make me look slim!!Wish they came in petite length but will buy again', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 28, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '1.0 out of 5 stars Saggy in crotch . Returned them', 'author': 'Sandra powers', 'rating': 1, 'content': 'Everything fit but my crotch area was sagging with all the extra material. I think it‚Äôs made for men or large women.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 1, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Good quality if u looking for sky pants', 'author': 'JRHW', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Good quality, great in snow. I was personally looking for a softer shell material, this was hissing to much when I walked , that‚Äôs why I think is more designed to wear in snow than to go to work', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 25, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Inseam is longer than described', 'author': 'Ch2', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'Size guide shows XL as 29.8‚Äù inseam but the pair I received was 31‚Äù. title: BROKIG Mens Zip Joggers Pants - Casual Gym Workout Track Pants Comfortable Slim Fit Tapered Sweatpants with Pockets
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Good looking and comfortable', 'author': 'Pugaloo', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I ordered this for my husband after he saw an ad for something similar that cost a lot more money on social media. These worked out great! Snug ankles that don‚Äôt bag, roomy and comfortable everywhere else, trendy and stylish to boot! He wears them to the gym and out and about. He liked them so much we just ordered another pair.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 27, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars My favorite thin jogger. Some colors look better than other.', 'author': 'Scott', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I recently purchased the BROKIG Mens Zip Joggers Pants and I have mostly positive feelings about them. While the fit is great and the material is comfortable, the color options are a little hit and miss.I found that for some reason, the grey colors look way better than the red, yellow, blue, and other options.On the positive side, the fit of these pants is great, especially if you have slightly thicker legs like I do. The waistband and cuffs have just the right amount of elasticity, ensuring a snug but comfortable fit. The zippers on the ankles are great for changing without needing to take off your shoes.Overall, I would recommend the BROKIG Mens Zip Joggers Pants to anyone looking for a comfortable and stylish pair of pants for workouts or casual wear. The grey color options are definitely the best, and the fit is spot-on for those with thicker legs. If you're looking for a reliable pair of pants that will keep you looking and feeling good, these are definitely worth checking out.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States April 24, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Great deal on these when purchased since gone up in price!', 'author': 'batchcorps', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'Overal for the money great no complaints.I am a big 6\'1" tall and 230lb man.They fit very snugly I purchased the largest size available and they fit snug.They give they feel comfortable and i like that the legs are very slim; no material flapping anywhere.Good value but tight fitting.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 17, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Not too skinny, not too baggy, they‚Äôre perfect!!!!!!', 'author': 'Manuel Torres', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I‚Äôm 5‚Äô7‚Äù tall, 190 lbs and I was looking for a jogger to wear to the gym. I didn‚Äôt want super skinny joggers but I also didn‚Äôt want them to be all baggy. These are EXACTLY what I was looking for. They are nice and slim but not skin-tight like some other brands. They‚Äôre ‚Äúslim-loose‚Äù. The material feels premium and they are super comfortable. I‚Äôll definitely order more pairs to wear them to the gym throughout the week.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 3, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars These fit my body perfectly, MOST of the time', 'author': 'zenraged', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I\'m 5\'10 150lbs and very athletically built. I\'ve been buying these in size Large because I feel like they do shrink a bit after a few washes. Also I suspect these pants are designed to fit tight, and I prefer a little extra room to move in.I currently have 5 pairs in Large and a few older pairs in Medium. Sometimes I\'ll receive a pair and the leg length will be shorter than usual. So the consistency of the product can fluctuate. This is rare though, usually they fit the same. I recently ordered the camo color pattern in Large and it fits the same around the waist but the length is definitely shorter than the other size Larges I have. Now that I own multiples of these I\'ll be able to detect right away when I receive a short one and make a return. However, if you\'re buying your first pair and receive one that seems shorter, it may be hard to tell.As I said before I\'m 5\'10" and 150LBS and the Large fits perfect and the length of the legs goes down below my ankle so that the pant legs rest on my shoes and my socks are hidden. When I perform a squat there is enough stretch and length to the pants that they don\'t ride up above my ankles either. That is, except on the camo model that has a shorter leg length. And until I order another camo model I don\'t know if this is due to the color pattern or just a random shorter length pair.These are my favorite pants, I continue to order them. I\'ve tried other variations from this company but these are my favorite.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 29, 2022', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars small is a bit baggy... wish x-small was still available', 'author': 'M', 'rating': 3, 'content': "initial quality seems very good. not sure how well it'll hold up after a few washes, but I can't find any flaws or QC issues out of the package which is great. i like the style and the fit, but small is a bit baggy. I was able to get an x-small a year ago-ish, but x-small doesn't ever seem to be in stock or the company stopped making them which is bad.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 8, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great Product..', 'author': 'Armando', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Perfect joggers. I‚Äôm 6‚Äô and 195 pounds with a 34-36 waist. Large is a great fit. Material is comfortable and surprisingly keeps me warm. Wasn‚Äôt sure because they are thinner than typical cotton sweats. Bought 2 and planning on 2 more colors now that I‚Äôve tried these with great results.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 5, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great fit', 'author': 'Amazon Customer', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Wasn‚Äôt sure my grandson would like the style and he did.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 15, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Perfect', 'author': 'Robert R. Pecoraro', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Form fitting sweats that look a little sexy I think. I do not workout in these. For me they are pants I wear with my regular clothes. I have received compliments when I wear these. Maybe I look good. Either that they noticeably look better then the other stuff I wear. Probably a little of both. üòÇ', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 9, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars way more that I expected', 'author': 'victor mendoza', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Nice quality, nice fit, I really like this product', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 5, 2024', 'is_verified': True}]

When I perform a squat there is enough stretch and length to the pants that they don\'t ride up above my ankles either. That is, except on the camo model that has a shorter leg length. I WAS IDEALLY LOOKING FOR A FIT AND STYLE COMPARABLE TO MY FAVORITE PAIR OF UMBRO SWEATPANTS, WHICH ARE VERY HIGH-END FIT AND QUALITY BUT I COULDN\'T FIND THOSE EXACT ONES. THESE AT LEAST HAD A SIMILAR STYLE AND APPEARANCE AND IT\'S A NICE BLUE COLOR (WANTED TO AVOID THE USUAL BORING BLACK/GRAY/WHITE ONES). I KNEW THAT THEY WOULD HARDLY COMPARE TO UMBROS BUT THIS WAS A "TEST PAIR" FOR A CHEAP PRICE. NOW, I NEVER NEED MORE THAN A 2XL WHEN I BUY SWEATPANTS LOCALLY BUT SOMETHING TOLD ME BASED ON THE CHEAP PRICE OF THESE SWEATPANTS ($11.49 OR SO), I\'D ORDER A 3XL. WHEN I TRIED IT ON IT WASN\'T TOO TIGHT AND IT DRAPED OK BUT KIND OF "JUST FIT". IT\'S LIKE THEY ARE MADE FOR TALL, VERY THIN "FAT" PEOPLE. I DIDN\'T WEAR THEM FOR MORE THAN A MINUTE, SO THEY MAY VERY WELL STRETCH OUT WITH DAILY MOVEMENT. THAT BEING SAID, I COULD ONLY IMAGINE THAT UNLESS I ALWAYS WASHED THEM IN COLD WATER AND ONLY AIR DRIED THEM OR IN THE DRYER ON ULTRA LOW HEAT, THEY WOULD END UP BEING WAY TOO TIGHT. I DECIDED TO GIVE THEM TO MY STEPDAD, WHO IS LIGHTER THAN ME. I PRETTY MUCH EXPECTED CHEAP CHINA MADE "CRAP" AND MY EXPECTATIONS WERE MET. THEY PROBABLY WERE EVEN MAILED FROM CHINA BECAUSE THEY TOOK A COUPLE OF WEEKS TO SHIP AND ARRIVE AND THE DAMN COST OF SHIPPING WAS MORE THAN THE CHEAPO SWEATPANTS (ABOUT $15.49 FOR A PACKAGE BAG THAT MAYBE WEIGHED 10-12 OUNCES). THERE DIDN\'T SEEM TO BE AN INDICATION IN THE SELLER INFORMATION THAT THEY WERE NOT COMING FROM A USA BASED LOCATION BUT I WASN\'T SURPRISED. title: Mens Cargo Pants Casual Drawstring Joggers Cotton Work Sweatpants Outdoor Trousers
reviews: [{'title': "5.0 out of 5 stars A Perfect Color for Fall (& Hallowe'en)!", 'author': 'WSR', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'The color of these pants is a little darker and a little browner than expected. However, the color contrasts well with a medium-orange shirt, which was purchased to complement the pants. The fabric is durable and comfortable. Though large is my usual size, I wanted something with a looser fit and longer legs. The XL I purchased meets my needs well. Hopefully the garment won‚Äôt shrink much when washed and dried. The pants do not have a fly, and this might be a concern for some -- but not for me!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 7, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '1.0 out of 5 stars Not sweatpants at all!', 'author': 'William Langston II', 'rating': 1, 'content': 'Not sweatpants üò°wanted these for football practice there to stiff of a material. Might be good for casual but not what I was expecting! Needs to change the description or make sure you read the reviews first. Thats where I messed up.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 21, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Not Fleece, more chino pants type of material', 'author': 'Rico', 'rating': 4, 'content': "My rating will not necessarily reflect yours, but here's what you might need to know before buying:MATERIAL: On the tag, it says 95% Cotton and 5% spandex which matches the product description online. As far as how accurate that it is, only China knows (Made in China).FABRIC: If you are looking for a fleece type of joggers similar to the name brand Nike, Adidas, and etc., this is not the fabric you are looking for. I have a Levi's Men's XX Chino Standard Taper Fit Stretch Pants, and the fabric feels exactly like that. This just means that it feels like khaki pants.LOOK/FIT: I'll keep it simple at the size/fit. These are loose fit, so if you looking for a joggers/tapered type of look these are not for you. I bought the gray ones, and the color look the same to me compared to the picture.QUALITY: (if you care about)-Drawstring is thin. It's just loose woven with what feels like cheap material that easily strings and catch fluff after a couple of washes. The drawstrings are long as well so a lot of room to adjust. Drawstring caps feels like metal.-The fabric for these as khaki pants are phenomenal. It's nearly identical fabric to my Levi's Chinos. But again, as a 'sweatpants' these are terrible fabric for getting a good sweat in (in my opinion).-Loose strings throughout the pants sticking out, not a lot, but noticeable. ( I just cut the loose strings on mine)AFTER WASHBackground (skip this paragraph if you don't care)I skipped the sizing because I expected these to shrink. How'd I know these will shrink? I have bought a lot of clothes throughout the years (on Amazon) from sellers and 90% of them all shrink in some type of way. Knowing this I bought a size up and did an aggressive first wash. Aggressive first wash just means I ran it in hottest water temperature in the washer, and followed by drying it in the hottest setting. After the first wash, the length of the pants shrank about 1.2 inches. Color stayed the same with no fading.Did it shrink? YesHow much? 1.2 inches (Length)Did color fade? NoIn what washer/dryer setting? Hottest setting on bothWhy the 4 star rating?I'm a laborer and I needed a good pair of work pants for half the price of name brand ones like Carhartt. These were around $25-27 when I bought them. The material I didn't care much what kind it was or where it was made. The fabric would be the best quality this item has, as it exceeded my expectations. The fit and look suites how I like my pants loose and baggy. I would say I took out 1 star from the drawstrings and loose strings. What about the shrinkage? I knew how to deal with it before hand, so I don't see a point taking points for something didn't cause me a headache.After a little over a month, I have been using these 3 days a week on my shifts which consist of constantly moving, squatting and kneeling. These pants are holding up really well for how much wear and tear put them through. I wash these about 1-2 times a week depending on how filthy they get. This was worth the price even if lasts me less than 6 months.Was it worth it? (Based on my purpose) YesBuy again? Yes, ordered another pair", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 26, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Not sweatpants but still nice', 'author': 'Deric', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I misunderstood these as being sweatpants. They should really take that out of the title. However, I really like these and the only way to improve these would be to have the draw string on the inside. I wear them to the office as that pass as a casual pair of cargo pants. They are very comfortable and I may get another pair in a different color.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 5, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Comfortable', 'author': '909', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'The most comfortable pair of pants I own. Definitely going to order another pair in a different color.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 4, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '1.0 out of 5 stars THE PANTS SHRUNK WITH ONE WASH!!', 'author': 'toriano baylor', 'rating': 1, 'content': 'the pants are brand new but i cant wear them they are to damn short i wore them ounce i want to return them', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 29, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '1.0 out of 5 stars Terrible Quality', 'author': 'CIG', 'rating': 1, 'content': 'After one wash they strunk from a XXL to L so quality is substandard', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 15, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars not sweatpants, but good', 'author': 'Nathaniel', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'not sweatpants but the material feels good. it is stiff and coarse and has velcro holding the pockets shut. good color. would recommend', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 12, 2024', 'is_verified': False}]

reviews: [{'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars Color is WAY off', 'author': 'ROBYN', 'rating': 3, 'content': "Although they're nice and fur like on the inside instead of regular fleece these really aren't any thicker then a similarly priced pair of Hanes sweatpants. Since I was planning on dying them along with a jacket I was planning to wear with them, which I would like them in teal, it wasn't a absolute deal breaker enough for me to return them. But is something that people may want to be aware of.Also it has regular elastic in it not no-roll elastic. So you do have to play with the elastic waist at times in order to get it to lie flat. title: Men's Hiking Cargo Pants Lightweight Quick Dry Outdoor Work Pants for Golf Athletic Travel with Multi Pockets
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Start your own trend', 'author': 'PhotoGraphics', 'rating': 5, 'content': "These are interesting men‚Äôs pants. The very first thing you notice is that they are tissue thin, they are virtually see-through. If you tend to go commando the world will immediately know it. On the positive side if you live in a hot humid area these are like wearing nothing at all. Add to that the fit which I will detail a little more below, I ordered what I thought would fit like a tent and they are actually rather snug, especially where it will graphically reveal anything and everything. Wear these when you are going to the disco hoping to get lucky.CONFUSINGThey need to get a consultant to help them with their ad. The most glaring error is that they have two sizing charts and both are different. Using the designation L for instance means nothing in men's pants sizing so a translation chart is necessary but which one is accurate? Another problem is understanding what the various word golf, hiking, track, etc. mean. I don't own any pants that would be suitable for all three activities, each is a specialty activity. I'm actually not sure what these would be most suitable for - I definitely would not take them hiking and they would be way out of place running on a track. They might be okay for golf but they look too dressy for that sport, yet they are not dressy enough to wear to the office. I think they have a real identity problem and a real need for a consultant.YES NO MAYBEDoes it sound like I dislike these? Well no. They will appeal to guys who are confident and don‚Äôt like bulky clothing, they are not skin tight, but they are snug where you might want them to be. They are absolutely almost see-through and that might make them go viral, that‚Äôs something I can‚Äôt predict. I lie clothes that start their own trend and these may be them.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 22, 2024', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars Decent pants, but way too large', 'author': 'Chewychomp', 'rating': 3, 'content': "I went with the recommended sizing, and they are quite a bit larger than I would have liked. Not so much that they're unwearable, but I do wish I had gone with the next size down. I normally wear a 34 or 36 waist pant size, so I went with the XL size with these, based on the chart. They fit more like a 40.The material feels nice, and is thin enough so these should be very comfortable in warmer weather, which is why I got them. The cargo pockets are a good size without protruding too much when not in use, and the hardware and zippers feel like they will hold up.I do recommend these, just beware that they fit larger than the chart might lead you to think.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 23, 2024', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Very lightweight but comfortable.', 'author': 'Robert C. Petersen', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'These fit very well in the waist and the length. I do hiking and sometimes go cross country through brush and trees. We‚Äôll see how they hold up in those condition. The lightweight also seems to make them more for summer use only. The belt loops fit my belts fine. They do have velcro closures on the cargo pockets but not on the back pockets. That is the main reason they are getting 4 stars. Overall they are a comfortable and stylish pair of pants.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 29, 2024', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Pleasantly surprised', 'author': 'Red', 'rating': 5, 'content': "Wasn't sure what to expect, but I am surprised with the fit and comfort these pants have. The fit is true to size and they are very comfortable. The belt loops fit my standard width belt and the legs fit over my boots just fine. The material is soft and pliable, stretchy, but at the same time, it seems reasonably durable.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 24, 2024', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars COOFANDY Hiking Cargo Pants- comfortable, but baggy and short', 'author': 'GB Philly Burbs', 'rating': 3, 'content': 'Pants fabric is light and stretchy. Grid reinforcement. Comfortable for warm weather use.Fit is baggy and short. I wear a USA 32"x32" but ordered size SMALL knowing that the seat was cut baggy and the elastic in waste would fit. However, the length is TOO SHORT- at least 1.5". OK if you wear down on your hips.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 25, 2024', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great Travel Pants for Hot Weather', 'author': 'PierrefromBayRidge', 'rating': 5, 'content': "These pants are super thin so very good for hot weather and with the large cargo pockets, you can stash a lot of stuff safely. I say safely because the Velcro closures are really tight so no one is going to be able to easily pull them open without you noticing. I don't play golf, so can't say whether or not they're good for golfing but as travel pants, they're perfect. The side pockets are nice and deep as well.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 20, 2024', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Lightweight, sizing a little odd', 'author': 'B. Hashimoto', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'Material is light and on the thinner side so good for summer.Back pockets have no Velcro or button, just flaps. Cargo pockets have VelcroBy the sizing chart I should have got a large but since it said ‚Äúslim fit‚Äù I ordered a size up. They‚Äôre a little loose on me but I‚Äôm glad I went up in size as the length is still a little short for my preference so I imagine the large would be very short.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 25, 2024', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars not slim fit, no zippers or velcro on rear pocket flaps', 'author': 'l2', 'rating': 3, 'content': 'I have a 34 inch waist and ordered these pants in size large, as recommended by the size chart. They pants fit me a little loose in the waist, but OK when I wear a belt. The legs are advertised as "slim fit", but I consider the fit I see on the model photo be loose fit and they fit me loosely as well. To me, "slim fit" is contoured and almost skin tight, but these pants are much looser than that.Fabric for these pants is thinner than most hiking pants, but maybe OK for hot summer climates if you don\'t care too much about durability.I like that the side cargo pockets are roomy enough for a modern smartphone. I do not like that the cargo pockets are secured by skimpy small pieces of fake velcro. I much prefer the security of zippers.I really do not like that the rear pockets have neither velcro nor zippers. There are flaps, but they are secured to nothing. A pick pocket would love these pants. I wouldn\'t even trust these flaps if my wallet was bouncing up and down on a rough and rocky trail. Quality US-brand hiking pants usually have zippers for all the larger pockets.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 25, 2024', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Perfect Fit', 'author': 'VA Doc', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I got these cargo pants to wear when flying or traveling long distances. They came shrink wrapped. They are made of lightweight thin stretchy polyester/spandex material. They are light enough to wear during the summer. I like the elastic waist band. Very comfortable. I‚Äôm 5‚Äô11‚Äù and 184 lbs - the size large fitted me perfectly. Overall, I rate it 5 stars.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 23, 2024', 'is_verified': False}]

Men's Fleece Sweatpants
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Comfy!', 'author': 'Julian', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I recently bought the Fruit of the Loom Men's Fleece Sweatpants, and they've quickly become my go-to for lounging and casual wear.The fleece material is soft and comfortable, providing a cozy feel without being too heavy. The elastic waistband with a drawstring ensures a secure fit, and the cuffs at the bottom keep the pants in place without being too tight.What stands out is the affordability without compromising on quality. These sweatpants offer a great balance between comfort and value for money. They're perfect for a relaxed day at home or a quick errand run.If you're looking for a no-frills, comfortable pair of sweatpants that won't break the bank, the Fruit of the Loom Men's Fleece Sweatpants are a solid choice. They're simple, comfortable, and budget-friendly.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 3, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Comfortable and Great price !!!', 'author': 'Amazon Customer', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Great price for the pair!! Very soft and true to size. Great for every day wear or the gym. Will be purchasing more!!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 21, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Good quality medium weight sweatpants.', 'author': 'PattyT', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'My son practically lives in sweats these days since he is working from home due to covid-19. I came across a two pack of these sweat pants for a good price and I picked the black duo up for him. He is 6\'1 and fairly thin at about 170 pounds but he hates tight sweats so I got size Large and I am glad I did. The waist on these is a little smaller than on other brands. My son usually wears size 33 or 34 waist in jeans and these fit him fine and aren\'t loose at all. The legs are roomy but not huge and the length is around 31" or maybe a little longer.The material is medium weight and these have pockets - a MUST! They\'re comfortable and don\'t pill after washing. The only issue with the black ones is that they pick up pet hair, dust, and all sorts of little bits as black fabrics usually do. But in general, these sweats are good quality and fit as expected although those with large waists may find that they are a bit tight around the belly. The price fluctuates so keep an eye on these if you\'re interested in buying them. I got the two pack for much less than the $25.00 they are selling for now.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States August 2, 2020', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Price, quality, fit, all very good. - Updated', 'author': 'JAMed', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I am homebound quite often, so having something that is easy care, comfortable, and warm enough but not hot was priority. Price was a strong consideration as well. Do note "homebound". I ordered one pair of these, as often if I try to order several, I end up disappointed and, being homebound, can\'t get stuff sent back in a timely fashion, so end up losing out then having to figure out if the items are even worthy of charity, then hoping I get the stuff in before it piles up. I wish shopping was simpler. In this case it was.Hmm... I was going to write that if you have bigger hips you should order bigger than typical waist size. No need. In reviewing my order, it seems I accidentally ordered a size smaller than what I usually order. They are a bit tight, but comfortable as in how jeans fit. I have been losing weight, if it hasn\'t been showing up when measuring waste, or so it seemed. I am going to have to say... I think these things fit just about exactly as they should, now that I cleared that up. Well, and I actually feel better, even if my waste measurement continues to tell me otherwise about my size. Take it where you can get it.Pajamas to pants, these really impressed me. And, yeah, I am picky. Actually, I would have no other problem, than ego, of wearing these downtown. To me, I have made them into my pajamas and wearing pajamas out just seems... wrong.Thank you, Fruit of the Loom! Wonderful. Encore!Update - After a year and change, I have decided these are the perfect house pants/winter pajamas. They have lasted as well as I could have hoped, and more really, fit like I prefer, wash easily, and wear comfortably. I have decided to buy two more pair. A couple of pair a year will see me in good supply. I\'m mostly waiting to die, but it seems as if I have a longer wait than what the docs freaked out about, so... might as well be comfortable. Just because you could be on the heart transplant list, and they missed it for twenty years, doesn\'t meant you are going to die any time soon. Probably. *grins*', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 20, 2013', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great price, great fit, great product. will buy again, for sure.', 'author': 'Rob Britt', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I don\'t know why anyone would spend more than ten bucks on sweatpants. ahem, excuse me, athletic wear. These are the best sweatpants ever. fleecy feeling soft goodness on the inside and perfect charcoal gray on the outside. (In the case of my order anyway.) These fit perfect with the drawstring on the inside to make them snug in case you overload the pockets. Yes! Pockets. Yay! Why does anyone make sweats without someplace to put your keys and your mp3 player/ iPhone/whatever?These fit great and my wife loves that they don\'t have \'saggy butt syndrome\' like some sweatpants. I got the mediums and the sizing is perfect, by the way. I was a little nervous, but went with the site recommendation. Waist and length are great. My inseam is about a 32" and these are right on! no dragging on the ground and they reach all the way past my shoes, so if there is a flood, I am not prepared. Will have to roll them up. (that\'s a good thing.) Will definitely revisit and buy again. Shipping was also fast and excellent packaging.11/26/17. It\'s about a year since I bought these and I have worn them many times and washed them many times. They have held up well. I got a comment on this review and just noticed it today and coincidentally I am wearing these very pants at the moment, so thought I\'d comment that they\'ve held up well. Cheers!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 6, 2016', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars Product matches pictures and description', 'author': 'BossMan', 'rating': 3, 'content': "In general, these sweatpants serve their purpose and perform adequately. They are functional and will keep you comfortable during casual activities. However, there are some specific design elements that might not align with everyone's preferences, including mine. One notable feature is that the pants gradually taper and become slimmer as they descend from the waist. Personally, I find this aspect less appealing. In my view, the width of the bottom hole should be proportional to the thigh-to-knee width, ensuring a more balanced and comfortable fit. However, with these pants, the ends narrow significantly, almost to half of the original hole size at the thigh, which can be a matter of concern for those who prefer a more relaxed and roomy fit.That said, it's essential to emphasize that while these sweatpants may have certain design quirks, they still serve their primary function quite well. They provide a level of comfort that's acceptable for casual wear and lounging. If you're looking for a budget-friendly option, these sweatpants might be a suitable choice, but I'd hesitate to spend more than 20 dollars on them again, considering the slight discomfort caused by the slimming design. There are alternatives on the market that offer a more balanced fit and design at a similar or slightly higher price point, so it might be worth exploring those options if you prioritize both comfort and style in your loungewear.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 11, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great Product!', 'author': 'Lynn Kostelecky', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'These sweatpants fit great!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 28, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Run a little small', 'author': 'S.
